story:
Rebuild America, one cob home at a time!

 

Buildings constructed using earthen materials, such as cob, will stand strong for hundreds of years, are relatively affordable, energy efficient, sustainable, and I can't imagine anything more lovely than a family, hand sculpting a new home together from the clay and sand beneath their feet! We wish to fund the professional construction of our own cob home by experienced cob home builders so that we can share this experience with our community and pass on these skills to our surrounding, tornado-stricken towns. Among many things, this is what we came here to do. Read our story: www.indygo.info

 

My name is Lori Moore and my husdand's name is Jeremy Moore. In our past lives, we lived on the northside of Chicago, Illinois. That was 4 years ago. We now live in bus in the woods, and we love it. Our two little girls love it too. We purchased the bus on Craigslist with  our tax return for $4000 and converted the interior into a comfortable living space using recycled and repurposed materials and furniture. That project is covered in detail at www.indygo.info .

We are aiming to change the global landscape, for the better, starting with our own homestead. We are certainly not pioneers of this effort - not in the last century, nor the last few millenia, for that matter. Our "advanced" technocratic society has created devastating effects on the green lands of this Earth, and on the daily lives of the families and individuals dwelling upon it. By revisiting all-but-forgotten methods of home construction, using earthen materials already available on one's home place, we may begin to build structures that blend into the landscape, as well as do much less harm to the environment surrounding it. Reeducating the communities on home planning  and development can bring much relief to those hit by tornadoes and free many others from the mortgages and that bind them.

Virtually all parents want to give their children a comfortable home, safety and security. This is what we want but it is hard to say if we are really providing these things when "family time" must be scheduled into weekends of working overtime, and when our houses are tacked together using toxic products that damage the environment in a monumental fashion. It doesn't have to be this way. It is possible to  pass down something of actual value to the next generation like the skills and the means to fabricate a house, using the materials found on (or nearby) the home site to make a warm, lovely home that will lasts for many generations.

We do not intend to live in the bus forever. We wish to become profficient at contructing cob homes so that we can help others do the same. If we can show others how they can design and build a unique, warm, strong, durable, well insulated home without a mortgage, we can begin to free a society. When a family sculpts a home together, they share family time together. People can choose, if they wish, to develop a homestead with their very own two hands. A "hard day of work" becomes a labor of love while spending a lifetime cultivating a space that will be eagerly inherited by the next generation. We can begin looking at our family lands as something so much more valuable than just an investment to be flipped for a profit. A homestead that is cultivated with love will give love in return. The fruits and vegetable grown in a space of love like this will be more nutritious than any food available anywhere else. We feel very strongly about our vision, and the direction of our lives. We know that this is what we are supposed to be doing as a couple and as parents.

With a little extra support, we can complete the first cob construction projects on our own land, beginning this Autumn of 2012 and with projected completion in the summer of 2013. We can share this experience with our friends and neighbors and upon completion, we can offer our new skills with the surrounding communities. Help directed towards us can come in many forms, of course. We are currently collecting bricks, blocks, cobblestone, gravel, steel drums (see: rocket mass heaters), 55 gallon plastic drums, railroad ties, oak timber, solid oak doors, terra cotta (broken or unbroken) rebinforcing steel bars) cement mix, wooden cedar shingles, wheel barrows, garden trailers, used window panes and denim jeans! 

It is important to note that a home does not consist of a shelter alone, and that developing an environment of permaculture to surround ones home will have lasting benefits on the health and happiness of those living within a home created in this manner.

Creating positive change in the world begins within one individual, within oneself. Improving the health and well being of a society begins within the family's home.

To learn more about cob houses, and straw bale construction please visit the following links:

www.strawbalestudio.com

www.thecobcottagecompany.com

www.cobhouse.net

www.cobprojects.info

www.firespeaking.com

www.thiscobhouse.com

 

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to get to know us. May you seek and find true happiness, health and love.

Until we meet, good-bye for now.

Lori
story_txt:
Rebuild America, one cob home at a time!
 
Buildings constructed using earthen materials, such as cob, will stand strong for hundreds of years, are relatively affordable, energy efficient, sustainable, and I can't imagine anything more lovely than a family, hand sculpting a new home together from the clay and sand beneath their feet! We wish to fund the professional construction of our own cob home by experienced cob home builders so that we can share this experience with our community and pass on these skills to our surrounding, tornado-stricken towns. Among many things, this is what we came here to do. Read our story: www.indygo.info

 
My name is Lori Moore and my husdand's name is Jeremy Moore. In our past lives, we lived on the northside of Chicago, Illinois. That was 4 years ago. We now live in bus in the woods, and we love it. story:
Short Summary

Hello, I am Robert from Romania.

I can't buy a phone cause of the awful enviroment we have here in Romania.I really need your help.

 

What We Need

I need about 650 EUR to buy a new phone.With this phone I can then develop applications for android which can help kids to learn a bunch of new and educative things.

I guess that if I don't reach the whole amount of money I will try it again because what I want to do is really useful.

story:
THANK YOU VERY MUCH TO EVERYONE WHO HAS SUPPORTED US

If you would like to contribute to the Last Ocean you can continue to donate through this Indiegogo Campaign or through FUNDRAISE ONLINE  NZ  or  OIKONOS - US 501(c)(3) NON-PROFIT 

 

When an international fishing fleet finds its way to the last untouched ocean on Earth – the Ross Sea in Antarctica - humanity is faced with a great challenge: do we fish the last ocean or do we protect it?

For the past seven years New Zealand filmmaker Peter Young has been part of a team working on a campaign to protect the Ross Sea, widely regarded as the most pristine marine ecosystem on Earth. A key tool in that campaign is his self-funded feature documentary The Last Ocean. Peter is taking the film on a road trip in the US, and then onto Europe, where he hopes to inspire audiences to support full protection of the Ross Sea.

The next few weeks are crucial. In July of this year, 25 Antarctic nations will gather in Bremerhaven, Germany, to decide whether or not to establish a large marine protected area in the Ross Sea. The lead up to Bremerhaven is our big opportunity to make a difference.

Speaking at a special screening of the The Last Ocean in Washington DC last month, US Secretary of State, John Kerry said he hoped that the film would inspire people to be responsible stewards of "this fragile planet".

Supporting this Last Ocean road trip is an opportunity to do just that. 

Find out about the issue here: www.lastocean.org 

Find out about the film here: www.thelastoceanfilm.com

View the film trailer here:

What is the Last Ocean Road Trip?

The Last Ocean road trip is a campaign tour to promote the protection of the Ross Sea. Peter Young is attending film screenings at the festivals listed below to give Q&A‘s and generate media interest. Between screenings the team will lobby supermarkets to stop selling Antarctic toothfish caught in the Ross Sea and ask consumers to stop eating it. (Antarctic toothfish is marketed as Chilean sea bass throughout North America).  Then, if our stretch goal is reached, Peter will head to Germany to hold special screenings ahead of the talks in Bremerhaven.

What we need...

Update:  Halfway into this campaign, we have reassessed our goals. At the very least we will get Peter to as many of the US festival screenings as possible, and if funding allows we will continue on to Bremerhaven, holding as many screenings as we can in Europe. 

Basic funding: we reach - $26,750 Peter attends film screenings in the US to give Q&A’s, generate media interest and raise awareness on a 25-day campaigining road trip from Newport, Rhode Island to San Francisco.

Stretch goal: we reach - $39,650 Peter travels to Germany for screenings. If successful we will have screenings in Hamburg, Berlin and Bremerhaven, as well as special screenings in London. An additional $ 13,000 is required for this European leg.                                                                                            

Tour Itinerary – intended stops 

23rd May - NewportFILM, Newport, Rhode Island - The Last Ocean is Newport’s Green Screen film this year. “Our world is all we have and newportFILM wants to shine a continuing light on the environmental challenges that face it.”

25-27th May - MountainFilm in Telluride, Colorado - MountainFilm is an iconic festival that screens exceptional films that make a difference.

31st May & 5th June - The Film Society of Lincoln Center Green Screens, New York City - Two screenings hosted by the prestigious Film Society of Lincoln Center. “Green Screens showcases engaging new documentaries about eco-crises and those fighting for solutions to the problems that plague our planet.”

7th & 8th June - Seattle International Film Festival, Seattle - Seattle International Film Festival, the largest, most highly attended film festival in the United States, is showing The Last Ocean for World Oceans Day.

14th,  18th, 23rd June - San Francisco Documentary Film Festival, California - With many of the Ross Sea scientistis as well as the Safeway Supermarkets head office located in the Bay area, these promise to be key screenings. 

21st June - Monterey Bay Aquarium- Special screening for the folk at Monterey Bay Aquarium, who recently decided to make Chilean Sea bass, includiing Antarctic Toothfish from the Ross Sea) ‘best choice’ in their Seafood Guide.

25th June - Safeway HQ at Pleasanton, California (TBC) - A celebratory screening for the folk at Safeway Supermarkets, who have already chosen NOT to sell Antarctic toothfish from the Ross Sea. 

25th June – Cinema Rialto, Hamburg, Germany - The Heinrich-Böll-Foundation, an agency for green visions and projects, is hosting a set of cinema events in the Hamburg Cinema Rialto. 

4th July - Royal Geographical Society, London, United Kingdom - The UK premier of The Last Ocean hosted by the Last Ocean Charitable Trust and the Ross family, decendants of explorer Sir James Clark Ross, who discovered the Ross Sea. 

5th July - Waiheke Island Community Cinema, New Zealand 

11th to 16th July – CCAMLR Special Meeting of the Commission, Bremerhaven, Germany - Peter Young will be holding events in Bremerhaven during the CCAMLR meetings.

20th July - NaturVision Film Festival Ludwigsburg, Germany - Germany's oldest nature and environmental film festival held in the media city of Ludwigsburg. 

 

Why is USA important?

Both US & NZ are key players in negotiations for a Ross Sea Marine Protected Area (MPA). They are jointly proposing a large MPA in the Ross Sea at a special meeting of the Commission for the Conservation of Antarctic Marine Living Resources (CCAMLR) this July in Germany. While the proposed MPA covers a considerable area, it allows for commercial fishing in the Ross Sea. We need both Governments to know that while this proposal is an important first step it does not go far enough and offer the Ross Sea the full protection it deserves.

Antarctic toothfish is currently caught in the Ross Sea by 7 fishing nations. Much of the catch ends up in the US where it is marketed as Chilean Sea bass. The US is home to several key seafood industry players including Monterey Bay Aquarium which publish the Seafood Watch Guide, and supermarkets chains Wholefoods, Kroger & Safeway.

The Last Ocean has already played at several film festivals in the US and it resonates well with American audiences. Bringing the film director to screenings attracts greater audiences, creates more impact and draws more media attention to the film and issue. 

What you get!

If you donate to our project you are not only supporting our campaign to save the Ross Sea - we have some unique perks that you won’t be able to get anywhere else! 

We’ve kept our gifts small simple and inexpensive so we are not sending stuff all over the world, and to make sure most of our funding goes to the campaign. See what’s on offer on right hand side of this page.

Please note: Indiegogo contributions are in USD. 

If you are unable to donate, there are other ways you can help:

  • Promote the film
  • Sign the AOA petition
  • Share this site
  • Write a letter to CCAMLR
  • Subscribe to our newsletter

And don’t buy Chilean sea bass from the Ross Sea. 

A final word...

“As a documentary cameraman I have filmed on every continent on Earth and the Ross Sea is one of the most special places I have been to. That is why I have been fighting tooth and nail for its protection for the past seven years. During that time we have gratefully received donations and while they have gone some way towards our goals, the Last Ocean campaign and film have largely been self-funded and have relied heavily on huge amounts of unpaid work from every member of the Last Ocean team. This final push calls for considerable resource - more than we have - but after years of work I feel we owe it to all those who have supported us, to the community that has joined us, and to the efforts that have gone before us, to complete the journey of this campaign and take our message to Bremerhaven - that there shuld be NO commercial fishing in the Ross Sea. What better gift could we leave our children than Earth's last truly wild ocean?”

Peter Young - Director, The Last Ocean 

Thank you for your support!

 

                          

 Please note: Indiegogo contributions are in USD.

story:
In an alternative vehicle, we will travel the lower 48 in pursuit of 30 plus stories to recognize household and business activities that support community and local resiliency.  The purpose of this project is to showcase local, practical, cost effective solutions to sustainable living including winning examples of using local foods and local energy.

It is these winning examples that will motivate and encourage a more positive response to energy security and climate change.  We know that there are technological solutions and top--down incentive programs for environmental action, but the key ingredient is missing: real people doing real work to lessen their impact on the environment. We're looking for everything from homesteading to up-cycling waste materials, alternative dwellings to local food programs, energy efficiency to alternative transportation, and everything in between.

All of our interviews are compiled onto our website, convenientresilience.com, to achieve the overarching goal of an interactive online resource and guide for applying these simple environmental initiatives to anyone’s life.It is our hope that this guide will act as a tool and platform for easily sharing knowledge and expertise across borders and interests.

After interviewing Lori Barg on her solar water heater in Plainfield, VT, we received contact from new friends in Nicaragua. They were so inspired by her simple design that they are looking to implement it across their country as a cost effective method to providing families with hot water.

With your support, we will be able to interview dozens of people across the country. Here is a sneak peek of some of the incredible projects we will be encountering.

Budget: 

$6,000-8,000 purchase of a vehicle

$2,000- fuel and maintenance/tolls on the road

$500- insurance

$2,000- food (10/day/per/100 days)

$1,000- camp lodging

$1,500- technology

 

Vermont:

  • Lori Barg: Solar Hot Water
  • Jill Bubier: Micro Hydro
  • Dave Palumbo of  Independent Power: Photovoltaics
  • Robert & Susan Lloyd: Off-Grid living
  • Moe O'Hara: Upcycling
  • Chapin Spencer of Local Motion: People powered transportation

Massachusetts:

  • Pedal People: Human powered delivery service
  • Cambridge Energy Alliance: Energy audits
  • Boston Food Swap: Sharing surplus food goods

New York: 

  • I Am Not A Virgin: Up-cycling beer bottled to jeans
  • Brooklyn Grange: Roof-top garden
  • Ulster County Tool Bank: Tool Shed Cooperative

Ohio: 

  • Natural Building Network & the Village Building Convergence: alternative building materials

Indiana:

  • 5 Kingdom Development: Environmental education, ecological & social health

Illinois: 

  • Midwest Permaculture: organic symbiotic relationship with land & living
  • The Plant: Vertical Farm and " food business incubator"

Missouri: 

  • Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage:

Minneapolis:

  • Harvest Moon Farmers: Backyard faming
  • Community Design Group: Sustainable mobility

Washington:

  • P-Patch Community Gardening: Cooperative Gardening

Oregon: 

  • POD Alternative Dwellings: Small, portable housing

California: 

  • Lucy Peniod: Native Gardening
  • Hayes Valley Farm: Bee Harvesting
  • Beth Terry: " My Life without Plastic"
  • The Ecology Center

New Mexico:

  • Earthship : Alternative building materials/sustainable housing 

Colorado: 

  • Eliu Hernandez: Upcycling

Texas: 

  • Sustain Center: Integrated sustainable systems
  • Dripping Spring Ollas: Efficient irrigation
  • Pure Salvage Living: Building houses with recycled material
  • In.gredients: Package free and zero waste grocery store

Alabama: 

  • Wayne Keith: Wood gas energy

Georgia: 

  • Box Car Grocer: Local food market
  • Ark Fab, Georgia Tech: Aquaphonics

South Carolina:

  • Groovy Garbage: Upcycling

story:
Motorcycles for Mongolian Park Rangers

 In August, 2017, ten intrepid and committed volunteers will join together in Ulaanbataar, Mongolia, with the goal of riding ten Yamaha AG200 motorcycles 1,200 miles to Otgontenger Strictly Protected Area, Mongolia and delivering these much needed machines to the park rangers there who patrol vast expanses of primitive protected lands. These pristine areas are under constant threat from poachers, ninja mining, commercial development, and ever increasing numbers of tourists. The rangers, who currently patrol on horseback and outdated motorcycles, are drastically under equipped for work in the remote and hostile environment they commit their lives to protecting.

Replacing Broken Equipment

The aging Chinese and Russian motorcycles used by rangers currently are breaking down and parts to fix them are less and less available. Meanwhile those that would harm the precious resources of Mongolia's protected areas have modern equipment. Your help with this effort will allow the purchase and delivery of one or more of these new motorcycles. Who will use them? Please take a moment to meet these amazing rangers by clicking here: http://www.rallyforrangers.org/meet-the-rangers-2017/

 

 

This is No Country Cruise...

 Off road riding in Mongolia is exactly how it sounds - rugged, hazardous, exhausting, exhilarating, painful, rewarding. A large support team is needed to care for the riders and the bikes to make sure all make it safely and intact to the remote Otgontenger Mountain. Yamaha technicians, cooks staff, drivers, photographers, and more make the journey in a caravan of unique support vehicles. Your contributions ensure as safe and successful a ride as possible.

Maybe you can't contribute $$...

Not everyone has the interest or ability to contribute financially. You can help in other ways by spreading the word about the effort and fundraising. You can send along a link to this Indigogo site or the link for the broader Campaign www.rallyforrangers.org. You can donate something I can auction for fundraising or something I can bring to the Mongolian rangers, their families and children. You can just say a good word or prayer of support for safety and success!

story:
Who are we?

We are crazy bunch of AIESECers from Universiti Malaysia Sarawak that decided to take up the challenge to organize a project called TechCycle Tech4All to be introduced to Kuching, Sarawak.

Why did we decide to do this campaign?

We’ll be honest to you.  AIESEC in Universiti Malaysia Sarawak was set up in 2013 and we have been receiving very little funds to sustain our growth. We do not have enough of cash and sponsors to carry out this project – THAT’S WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP! AND SUPPORT! WITH LOTSA LOVEEE!

What is TechCycle Tech4All?

TechCycle Tech4All is a project that will be carried out under AIESEC in Universiti Malaysia Sarawak and it is powered by AIESEC Malaysia and SOLS 24/7 aiming to create awareness on technology recycling, while enabling technology education to the underprivileged.

Our Mission!

Think about all the unattended electronic waste such as your computers, laptops, mobile phones and entertainment devices that are not in used. You are probably thinking about being ‘responsible’ and throwing it away. Without realising, we are actually causing a silent threat that is seeping into our water, soil and air.

Carcinogens, dioxins and heavy metals are being consumed by both animals and humans and if exposed for long periods of time, these metals can cause damage mental or internal harming of the liver, lungs and kidneys.

Scary as it sounds, it is time for all of us to take a step back and do something good by donating your unwanted digital devices. We will be setting up booths in shopping malls and universities to collect electronic waste.

Once all of these electronic wastes are collected, we will send it over to SOLS TECH for refurbishment. Digital devices will be upgraded repaired and installed with new software.

All refurbished hardware will be given free of charge to the poor and underprivileged, solving two major development issues and aiding future generations in one fell swoop.

The Impact!

  • Reduced e-waste with increasing awareness among people.

  • Educating underprivileged community in Malaysia with basic IT and computing skills.

  • Increase employability of underprivileged.

  • Saving Mother Nature from hazardous substances such as lead, mercury and cadmium that are being dumped in landfills, leading to contamination!

Who are we?

We are crazy bunch of AIESECers from Universiti Malaysia Sarawak that decided to take up the challenge to organize a project called TechCycle Tech4All to be introduced to Kuching, Sarawak.

Why did we decide to do this campaign?

We’ll be honest to you.  AIESEC in Universiti Malaysia Sarawak was set up in 2013 and we have been receiving very little funds to sustain our growth. We do not have enough of cash and sponsors to carry out this project – THAT’S WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP! AND SUPPORT! WITH LOTSA LOVEEE!

Carcinogens, dioxins and heavy metals are being consumed by both animals and humans and if exposed for long periods of time, these metals can cause damage mental or internal harming of the liver, lungs and kidneys.

Scary as it sounds, it is time for all of us to take a step back and do something good by donating your unwanted digital devices. We will be setting up booths in shopping malls and universities to collect electronic waste.

Once all of these electronic wastes are collected, we will send it over to SOLS TECH for refurbishment. Digital devices will be upgraded repaired and installed with new software.

All refurbished hardware will be given free of charge to the poor and underprivileged, solving two major development issues and aiding future generations in one fell swoop.

The Impact!

  • Reduced e-waste with increasing awareness among people.

  • Educating underprivileged community in Malaysia with basic IT and computing skills.

  • Increase employability of underprivileged.

  • Saving Mother Nature from hazardous substances such as lead, mercury and cadmium that are being dumped in landfills, leading to contamination!

The Budget

Week 1 - Week 4 ( 1st May - 31st May 2014), Collection & Promoting At Shopping Malls and Schools

  • Food and drinks = MYR 2 016
  • Accommodation + Transportation = MYR 735
  • Stationery = MYR 28
  • Booth = MYR 490
  • Contingency Plans = MYR 100
  • Exhibition Expenses = MYR 300

TOTAL : RM 3 369 (Approx 1133 USD)

How can you help us?

A minimum donation of 2 USD will do A LOT or by helping us to make some noise on Facebook/Twitter or any social media sites to help us get donation for this project. ‘Sharing is caring’ ;)

*We got not money in our pocket :( *

#aiesecunimas

This page is available in 2 languages:
E N G L I S H - F R E N C H - S P A N I S H  and  G E R M A N



* Aerial View * Vue Aerienne * Vista Aerea * Luft Aufnahme *

                                    

 

THIS SITE IS MULTILINGUAL

ENGLISH
        

      Link  english *******     Link  german

 THE ISLAND OF THE LIFE IN PARAGUAY.

We create the paradise
The island where you can live, live as you be or how you want to be.
You, the one hand as a holiday and recreation, or even –can use as your retirement home- if you want to.

None (pure) holiday island!
Although people need time, to be in a limited island to find peace and inner balance too. But here everyone should and can be constantly as he wants to be, or is. At the same time these “ISLAND OF THE LIFE” should meet as a foundation of the environment in which people, animals and plants can living together.

How it began:
The “island of the life” in Paraguay is part of a small mountain in which you may use for holidays and recreation, or even as a retirement home. But it is not a pure holiday resort. Although people need islands to gain inner peace and balance it is exactly here where you can be as you are –or as you want to be-. In parallel this island functions as a foundation where people, animals and plants could establish their “being with each other”. In 2008 I was sent to Paraguay by an inner voice, my voice that always is connected with my higher self. Out of the economic world of money and hurry and stress into a country slightly larger than Germany, with only 6 millions inhabitants. Very quickly it became clear that I should be here and why. A country that for decades had been abused and raped by jungle clearing (“killing”), and raped through mass livestock and other agricultural projects. Here now you find a small oasis of tranquillity, an oasis of silence, an oasis within nature should arise with humans, plants and animals that should serve as a positive example. On the other hand, however, our natural right and opportunity to live a natural life within nature should be achieved. My SELF BEEING has always been contrary to the “idea” that man should live imprisoned in stone or concrete blocks, and one tells you that the paradise would be a restricted natural resource, a closed shop. In fact man is part of the nature and paradise and is living much better and healthier in and with the nature. Neparo is my spiritual name given to me by my last teacher Michael Barnett. Neparo means “Cosmic Dancer”, which means as much as: “You’re the center of the universe when you’re moving and if you dance, then the universe dances andmoves with sheer joy with you and around you”.

Reorientation:
One thing was clear, the country was expecting a return through reforestation, restructuration and healing. And it was a mountain plot of 10 hectares (100.000 sqm), which was almost completely cleared purchased.

SO SAW IT ALMOST EVERYWHERE                         

                                                                           

AFTER ONLY ONE YEAR

                                                                           

Locale Features:
Yes, the property has a special power, and anyone who is familiar with the ancient civilizations, knows and will soon find out why many ancient cultures have sougth to establish themselves in the mountains. In the mountains, in the rocks, the layers of earth where there are thousands of folded and formed by earth move ments, a higher energy of the earth, a higher vibration in the Earth Grid is present. The plot has a very high vibration.

Old Wounds
But what did my heart hurt more is the fact that it once on this mountain and source plot were so many sources, all of which were dry. We found evidence for the beneficial water past numerous canyons where the water had honed over thousands of years, of channels up to 20 meters deep in the ground and in the rocks. And I saw in my vision that millions of gallons of water that would flow again from the mountain springs, if we humans would treat very well this tortured Earth.

                                                                                           

Healing Process:
Said and done, everything went as if by magic. We have the water flow of the measured sources still available after a drought time of 3 months in 2009 and it came to 86.5000 liters per day. A friend and I put our money into a common fund, we acquired the land relatively expensive.

But the reputation, even to help us as human beings and our descendants –to create a better world- was so strong that we had to go into this project simply. We immediately began to plant thousands of trees. To this end, we commissioned indigenous Paraguayans to us, for a reasonable wage to collect seeds of native precious and noble trees, from which we grow more than 10.000 young trees (saplings), we planted them for the most part ourselves. On top of that we are bringing up other crops on the land, there to make a new forest culture arise that allows you to live within nature and with nature.

       

Today, after 5 years to flow through the work and time spent together, within one day more than 6 millions liters (6.000 m³) of spring water from the plot out! Measure from to 2012 to 2013 during 3,5 months without rain.

A SMALL SOURCE IN 12 HOURS 18.000 LITERS WATER GENERATED.

                                                                                                                  

Everything is slowly recovering, the forest grows
it bloom again the bushes and shrubs
and thrive again the most beautiful plants and fruits.

                                     

                           

Thieving Exploitation:
Unfortunately, the little old forest stand was robbed in the size of 1.5 acres, and there were more than 120 trees at the age of 20 and 50 years and older felled and removed.

            


                             

The perpetrators have been identified. There certainly are not criminals, because people need to eat of somehow. You just do not have the awareness of what caused the depletion everything, and they lack financing which allows to shape the land through reforestation and forest management.
Therefore, it is only operated mainly livestock, sugar cane and soybeans, which pretty quickly money is earned, and therefore committed exploitation of nature. Therefore, it is our intention with our project, also educate people and help them with advices and support. We are sure to reach us rethink and another action here. Yes, some of our neighbors want already supported us, they even want to project of to sale a portion or all their land –almost 140 acres-. The surrounding land, of which we speak here is directly in the conservation area and desperately needs our help.

Our new meeting place:

For about a year we are building as the center of the project, a small house, which will later serve as a small restaurant and meeting place. We are working hard to complete.

                               

Our Source:
We have enclosed a small water supply source that has a reservoir of almost 18.000 liters and with which we can supply the house and still planned buildings and swimming facilities without electricity, using only the force of gravity.

                                                                  

We will also use water turbines, because the island life is to be supplied with electrical energy by way absolutely self-sufficient. With this an enclosed source, we can provide without side effects, up to 100 buildings with clean spring water.

Multiple Use:
A portion of the spring water we will conduct permanently by the individual swimming and water basins, and the overflow of the water is then to be used by the still to be built raised beds –where we want to draw organic vegetables- are cast. Here we will create the beds so that water –after work- flows back into the stream, and thus also a cycle is created.
*************************************************************************************************
The total capital requirement for the project is U$S 600.000.-
On this case U$S 15.000.- for the completion of the house and the surrounding paths.
For the creation of a swimming pool of U$S 5.000.-
For the installation of new water lines and the construction of 10 raised beds U$S 15.000.-
U$S 15.000 for the purchase and installation of water turbines.
For the construction of five guesthouses are needed U$S 150.000.-
For the purchase of a further 110 hectares, of which will be also reforested, are required U$S 250.000.-
To cover wages and the small demand, such as the collecting of seeds and breeding of trees for the next 1-2 years, U$S 150.000.-
************************************************************************************************
Alternative:
What happens if we do not reach our goal, and the U$S 600.000 do not get along?

Except that the project creates a longer path for further completion, nothing else happens.
This project is not just money that is needed. It lives by the people already involved and will continue to live and grow. Only just a little slower.

***********************************************************************
Our Thank You Bueffet :

We give about rich Each a small Thank You . This is can be used from a little card that is redeemable for holiday. However, the vouchers are also collectible . And if Someone vouchers from more than U.S. $ 5.000, - has , he may redeem them for a small building plot on the edge of the island life . Hence we have an extra at the foot of the hill country 12 plots of building land of 25 x 25 meters , so divided 625 sqm. Who vouchers from more than U.S. $ 7.000, - has collected that can redeem them against a land plot on the edge of the island life , on the upper mountain national border to the island life . Here we have another 18 plots of building land of 25 x 25 meters so divided 625 sqm. For the absolute nature loving helpers: Who U.S. $ 20.000, - or donates more , or vouchers of more than U.S. $ 20,000 - has collected, the land gets a dierekt within the nature reserve , in the woods . Absolutely individually . Here, however, can only 6 parcels on GROUND (99 years) will be awarded. The GROUND is entered and guarantees in the land registry and can be traded and passed on.

After the addition of the other Buy hectares, Everyone gets the more than U.S. $ 5.000, - has Donated, or for more than U.S. $ 5.000, - Vouchers collected, gets a land base within, the then 120-acre island life. Of course, we pay attention to the possibility of a good access and walkability. For each land a 5-meter wide access road will be built. Who, more than $ 5,000 - Donated or has collected of vouchers that can redeem them on demand against several land parcels.
We can total vouchers of $ 1.200,000, - forgive.
We can forgive a total of 240 plots of building land.


http://www.LIFEANDBEING.NET

************************************************************************************************


GERMAN


                        
    Link  english  *******  Link german

DEUTSCH

Die Lebensinsel in Paraguay.
in der DU leben und SEIN kannst wie Du bist, oder wie Du sein moechtest, ist wie eine Oase auf einem kleinen Berg in Paraguay, die Du einerseits als Urlaubs-und Erholungsziel, oder gar –wenn Du das moechtest auch als deinen Altersruhesitz nutzen kannst.

Keine (reine) Urlaubsinsel!
Menschen benötigen zwar zeitlich begrenzte Inseln um zur inneren Ruhe und zur Ausgeglichenheit zu finden. Doch hier soll und darf Jeder dauernd so sein wie er sein möchte, oder ist. Gleichzeitig soll diese LEBENSINSEL als Stiftung der Umwelt gerecht werden, in der Menschen, Tiere und Pflanzen miteinander Leben und sein koennen.

Wie es begann:
Im Jahr 2008 wurde ich durch eine innere Stimme, durch meine Stimme die immer mit meinem hoeheren Selbst in Verbindung steht, nach Paraguay gefuehrt. Heraus aus der wirtschaftlichen Welt das Geld verdienen in ein Land, etwas groesser als Deutschland, mit nur knapp 6 Millionen Einwohner. Sehr schnell wurde klar, was ich hier sollte. Ein Land, das von so vielen Menschen seit Jahrzehnten durch massenhaftes Urwald roden, durch massenhaften Tierhaltung und andere landwirtschaftliche Projekte missbraucht und vergewaltigt worden war. Hier sollte eine kleine Oase der Stille, eine Oase der Ruhe, eine Oase innerhalb del Natur mit Pflanzen und Tieren entstehen, die einerseits als positives Beispiel dienen kann und wird. Anderseits aber auch uns Menschen das Recht und die Moeglichkeit einraeumt, innerhalb del Natur und mit der Natur, leben und sein zu koennen. Meinem SEIN war es schon immer zuwider, dass der Mensch in Stein-oder Betonburgen eingesperrt leben soll, und das man die Welt zu einem gesperrten Naturparadies erklaeren will. Kommt doch auch der Mensch aus del Natur und kann viel besser und gesuender leben in und mit de Natur.

Neuorientierung:
Eines war klar, das Land erwartete eine Rueckgabe durch Wiederaufforstung, eine Wiedergutmachung und Heilung. Und so wurde ein Berggrundstueck von 10 Hektar Groesse (100.000 qm), welches fast vollstaendig gerodet war, gekauft.

SO SAH ES FAST UEBERALL AUF DEM GRUNDSTUECK AUS
KEINE PFLANZEN, KEINE BAEUME,

                                                                                               

NACH NUR EINEM JAHR

                                                                                              

Lokale Besonderheiten:
Ja, das Anwesen hat eine besondere Energie, und wer sich mit alten Zivilisationen beschaeftigt, der wird bald herausfinden, warum es so viele alte Kulturen in die Berge zog. In den Bergen, im Gestein, da wo die Erdschichten tausendfach gefaltet und durch Erdbewegungen entstanden sind, ist eine hoehere Energie der Erde, eine hoehere Schwingung im Erdgitternetz vorhanden. Das Grundstueck hat eine sehr hohe Eigenschwingung.

Alte Wunden:
Aber was meinem Herzen besonders weh tat, war die Tatsache, dass es einmal auf diesem Berg- und Quellgrundstueck so viele Quellen gab, die alle versiegt waren. Wir fanden zum Beweis der segensreichen Wasservergangenheit zahlreiche Schluchten, wo sich das Wasser ueber Jahrtausende Rinnen bis zu 20 Meter Tiefe in den Boden und in den Felsen geschliffen hatte. Und ich sah in meiner Vision wieder Millionen von Litern Wasser die wieder aus den Bergquellen sprudeln wuerden, wenn wir Menschen us dieser gequaelten Erde annehmen wuerden.

                                                                                                                 

Heilungsprozess:
Gesagt, getan, alles lief wie von Geisterhand gesteuert. Wir haben den Wasserfluss der noch vorhanden Quellen nach einer Trockenzeit von 3 Monaten im Jahren 2009 ausgemessen und kamen dabei auf 86.5000 Litern pro Tag.
Eine Freundin und ich legten unser Geld in eine gemeinsame Kasse, wir erwarben das Grundstueck relativ teuer. Aber der Ruf, uns selbst als Mensch und unseren Nachkommen zu helfen –eine bessere Welt zu erschaffen- war so stark, dass wir einfach in dieses Projekt einsteigen mussten. Wir fingen sofort an, tausende Baeume zu pflanzen. Hierzu beauftragten wir einheimische paraguayer uns gegen einen vernuenftigen Lohn, Samen von einheimischen kostbaren und edlen Baeumen zu sammeln, aus denen wir mehr als 10.000 junge Baeume zogen die wir zum Grossteil selbst einpflanzten.
Hinzu kommt dass wir weitere Kulturpflanzen auf dem Grundstueck asubrachten, um dort eine neue Waldkultur entstehen zu lassen, die es ermoeglicht, innerhalb der Natur und mit der Natur zu leben.

                         

Heute, nach fast 5 jaehriger Arbeit, fliessen durch die gemeinsam investierte Arbeit und Zeit, innerhalb eines Tages wieder mehr als 6 Millionen Liter (6.000 m³) Quellwasser aus dem Grundstueck heraus!. Ausgemessen im Jahre 2012 auf 2013 nach 3,5 Monaten ohne Regen.

EINE KLEINE QUELLE DIE IN 12 STUNDEN 18.000 LITER WASSER ERZEUGT,

                                                                                                                           

Alles erholt sich langsam, der Wald waechst,
es bluehen wieder die Baesche und Straeucher,
und es gedeihen wieder die herrlichsten Pflanzen und Fruechte.

                          

                 

Diebischer Raubbau:
Leider wurde der kleine alte Waldbestand in der Groesse von 1,5 Hektar ausgeraubt, und dort wurden mehr als 120 Baeume im Alter von 20 und 50 Jahren und aelter gefaellt und abtransportiert.

                           


                                                            

Die Taeter stehen fest.Es sind sicherlich keine Kriminellen, denn die Menschen muessen sich ja irgendwie ernaehren. Ihnen fehlt einfach noch das Bewusstsein darueber was der Raubbau alles verursacht, und ihnen fehlt auch eine Finanzierung die es ermoeglicht, das Land durch Wiederaufforstung und Waldwirtschaft zu gestalten. Deshalb wird ueberwiegend nur Tierhaltung sowie Zuckerrohr- und Sojaanbau betrieben, womit ziemlich schnell Geld verdient wird, und damit Raubbau an der Natur begangen. Deshalb ist es unser Anliegen, mit unserem Projekt, die Menschen auch aufzuklaeren, und Ihnen mit Rat und Tat zur Seite zu stehen. Wir sind uns sicher hier ein anderes Handel und ein Umdenken im Sinne des Naturschutzes zu erreichen.  Ja einige unserer Nachbarn, wollen uns bereits unterstuezten, sie wollen sogar einen Teil Ihres Landes, manche gar Ihr ganzes Land an das Projekt verkaufen.
Hier kommen knapp 140 Hektar zusammen. Das umliegende Land von dem wir hier sprechen, ist schon Naturschutzgebiet.
Es benoetigt aber die gleiche Hilfe wie auch die Menschen vor Ort.

Unser neuer TREFFPUNKT
Seit etwa einem Jahr, bauen wir als Zentrum des Projektes, ein kleines Haus. Es soll spaeter als Restaurant und Treffpunkt dienen. Hier koennen dann unterschiedliche Veranstaltungen der einzellnen Gruppen stattfinden.

                       
Unsere Quelle
Wir haben zur Trinkwasserversorgung eine kleine Quelle eingefasst. Die Quelle erzeugte schon nach nur einem Jahr in 12 stunden 18.000 Liter Wasser.

                                                                        

wir werden hier auch Wasserturbinen einsetzen um zusaetzlich Strom zu erzeugen. Denn die Lebensinsel soll nach Moeglichkeit Autark sein. trotzdem haben wir eine eigene Stromleitung mit 12.000 Volt/Ampere.
Die eingefasste Quelle kann bis zu 100 Einfamilienhaeuser mit Wasser Versorgen, da jede Parzelle-jedes Haus einen eigenen Wasserturm erhaellt.

Mehrfachnutzung
Einen Teil des kostbaren Quellwassers, werden wir durch das Schwimmbecken in unsere Obst und Gemuesebeete/Hochbeete leiten, um so noch einen groesseren Nutzen zu haben.

*************************************************************************

Der Kapitalbedarf

Der Kapitalbedarf liegt insgesammt bei US$ 600.000,-
Hiervon werden US$ 15.000,- fuer die fertigstellung des Gemeindehauses und der umliegenden Wege benoetigt.
Fuer die Erstellung eines Pools werden US$ 5.000,- benoetigt.
Fuer die Verlegung von weiteren Wasserleitungen und dem Bau von 10 Hochbeeten US$ 15.000,-
Fuer den Kauf und Montage von Wasserturbinen werden US$ 15.000,- benoetigt.
Fuer den Bau von 5 Gaestehaeusern werden US$ 150.000,- benoetigt.
Fuer den Ankauf von weiteren 110 Hektaren, die wir ebenfalls Aufforsten und schuetzen wollen, werden benoetigt US$ 250.000,-
Um Loehne und den Kleinbedarf , wie auch das Sammeln und Anzuechten von kostbaren Samen, fuer die naechsten 1-2 Jahre zu decken, werden benoetigt US$ 150.000,-

************************************************************************

Alternative:

Was passiert, wenn wir das Ziel von US$ 600.000,- nicht erreichen???

Ausser das dem Projekt ein laengerer Weg bis zur Fertigstellung entsteht, passiert nichts. Denn das Projekt lebt nicht alleine von dieser Aktion und Praesentation.

Die beteiligten Personen werden das Projekt weiter betreiben und am Leben erhalten.

*************************************************************************

Unser Dankeschoen Bueffet:

Wir moechtem Jedem ein kleines Dankeschoen ueberreichen. Dies soll aus einem kleinen Gutschein, der zum Urlaub eintauschbar ist genutzt werden koennen.

Die Gutscheine sind aber auch Sammelbar. Und wenn Jemand Gutscheine von mehr als US$ 5.000,- hat, so kann er diese einloesen gegen eine kleine Bauparzelle am Rande der Lebensinsel. Hierfuer haben wir extra am Fusse des Berggrundstueckes 12 Bauland Parzellen von 25 x 25 Metern, also 625 qm abgeteilt.

Wer Gutscheine von mehr als US$ 7.000,- gesammelt hat, der kann diese einloesen gegen eine Bauland Parzelle am Rande der Lebensinsel, an der oberen Grundstuecksgrenze zur Lebensinsel. Hier haben wir weitere 18 Bauland Parzellen von 25 x 25 Metern also 625 qm abgeteilt.

Fuer die absolut Natur liebenden Helfer:

Wer US$ 20.000,- oder mehr spendet, oder Gutscheine von mehr als
US$ 20.000,- gesammelt hat, der bekommt eine Bauland Parzelle dierekt innerhalb des Naturschutzgebietes, im Wald. Absolut individuell.
Hier koennen aber nur 6 Parzellen auf ERBPACHT ( 99 Jahre ) vergeben werden.

Die ERBPACHT wird im Grundbuch eingetragen und garantiert und kann gehandelt und weiter gegeben werden.

  

Nach dem Hinzu Kaufen der anderen Hektaren, bekommt Jeder der mehr als US$ 5.000,- Gespendet hat, oder der mehr als fuer US$ 5.000,- Gutscheine gesammelt hat, eine Bauland Parzelle innerhalb, der dann 120 Hektar grossen Lebensinsel. Selbstverstaendlich achten wir auf die Moeglichkeit eines guten Zuganges und der Begehbarkeit. Zu jedem Bauland wird ein 5 Meter breiter Zugangsweg errichtet. 

Wer mehr als US$ 5.000,- Gespendet oder an Gutscheinen Gesammelt hat, der kann diese auf Wunsch gegen mehrere Bauland Parzellen eintauschen.

Wir koennen insgesamt Gutscheine von US$ 1.200.000,- vergeben.

Wir koennen insgesamt 240 Bauland Parzellen vergeben.


                        
    Link  english  *******  Link german

This page is available in 2 languages: E N G L I S H - F R E N C H - S P A N I S H  and  G E R M A N

* Aerial View * Vue Aerienne * Vista Aerea * Luft Aufnahme *

                                      
THIS SITE IS MULTILINGUAL

ENGLISH           
      Link  english *******     Link  german THE ISLAND OF THE LIFE IN
PARAGUAY.
We create the paradiseThe island where you can live, live as you be or how you want to be.You, the one hand as a holiday and recreation, or even –can use as your
retirement home- if you want to.
None (pure) holiday island!Although people need time, to be in a limited island to find peace and
inner balance too. But here everyone should and can be constantly as he wants to be, or is.
At the same time these “ISLAND
 OF THE LIFE” should meet
as a foundation of the environment in which people, animals and plants can
living together.
How it began:The “island of the life” in Paraguay is part of a small
mountain in which you may use for holidays and recreation, or even as a
retirement home. But it is not a pure holiday resort. Although people need
islands to gain inner peace and balance it is exactly here where you can be as
you are –or as you want to be-. In parallel this island functions as a
foundation where people, animals and plants could establish their “being with
each other”. In 2008 I was sent to Paraguay by an inner voice, my
voice that always is connected with my higher self. Out of the economic world
of money and hurry and stress into a country slightly larger than Germany,
with only 6 millions inhabitants. Very quickly it became clear that I should be
here and why. A country that for decades had been abused and raped by jungle
clearing (“killing”), and raped through mass livestock and other agricultural
projects. Here now you find a small oasis of tranquillity, an oasis of silence,
an oasis within nature should arise with humans, plants and animals that should
serve as a positive example. On the other hand, however, our natural right and
opportunity to live a natural life within nature should be achieved. My SELF BEEING has always been contrary to the “idea” that man should
live imprisoned in stone or concrete blocks, and one tells you that the
paradise would be a restricted natural resource, a closed shop. In fact man is
part of the nature and paradise and is living much better and healthier in and
with the nature. Neparo is my spiritual name given to me by my last teacher
Michael Barnett. Neparo means “Cosmic Dancer”, which means as much as: “You’re
the center of the universe when you’re moving and if you dance, then the
universe dances andmoves with sheer joy with you and around you”.
Reorientation:One thing was clear, the country was expecting a return through
reforestation, restructuration and healing. And it was a mountain plot of 10
hectares (100.000 sqm), which was almost completely cleared purchased.
SO SAW IT ALMOST EVERYWHERE                          
                                                                            


AFTER ONLY ONE YEAR
                                                                            
Locale Features:Yes, the property has a special power, and anyone who is familiar with
the ancient civilizations, knows and will soon find out why many ancient
cultures have sougth to establish themselves in the mountains. In the mountains, in the rocks, the layers of earth where there are
thousands of folded and formed by earth move ments, a higher energy of the
earth, a higher vibration in the Earth Grid is present. The plot has a very
high vibration.

Old WoundsBut what did my heart hurt more is the fact that it once on this
mountain and source plot were so many sources, all of which were dry. We found
evidence for the beneficial water past numerous canyons where the water had
honed over thousands of years, of channels up to 20 meters deep in the ground
and in the rocks. And I saw in my vision that millions of gallons of water that
would flow again from the mountain springs, if we humans would treat very well
this tortured Earth.
                                                                                            


Healing Process:Said and done, everything went as if by magic. We have the water flow of
the measured sources still available after a drought time of 3 months in 2009
and it came to 86.5000 liters per day. A friend and I put our money into a
common fund, we acquired the land relatively expensive.But the reputation, even to help us as human beings
and our descendants –to create a better world- was so strong that we had to go
into this project simply. We immediately began to plant thousands of trees. To
this end, we commissioned indigenous Paraguayans to us, for a reasonable wage
to collect seeds of native precious and noble trees, from which we grow more
than 10.000 young trees (saplings), we planted them for the most part
ourselves. On top of that we are bringing up other crops on the land, there to
make a new forest culture arise that allows you to live within nature and with
nature.        


Today, after 5 years to flow through the work and time spent together,
within one day more than 6 millions liters (6.000 m³) of spring water from the
plot out! Measure from to 2012 to 2013 during 3,5 months without rain.
A SMALL SOURCE IN 12 HOURS 18.000
LITERS WATER GENERATED.
                                                                                                                   


Everything is slowly recovering, the forest growsit bloom again the bushes and shrubsand thrive again the most beautiful plants and fruits.
                                         

                              


Thieving Exploitation:Unfortunately, the little old
forest stand was robbed in the size of 1.5 acres, and there were more than 120
trees at the age of 20 and 50 years and older felled and removed.


               
                               


The perpetrators have been identified. There certainly are not
criminals, because people need to eat of somehow. You just do not have the
awareness of what caused the depletion everything, and they lack financing
which allows to shape the land through reforestation and forest management.Therefore, it is only operated mainly livestock, sugar cane and
soybeans, which pretty quickly money is earned, and therefore committed
exploitation of nature. Therefore, it is our intention with our project, also educate people and
help them with advices and support. We are sure to reach us rethink and another
action here. Yes, some of our neighbors want already supported us, they even
want to project of to sale a portion or all their land –almost 140 acres-. The
surrounding land, of which we speak here is directly in the conservation area
and desperately needs our help.


Our new meeting place:For about a year we are building as the center of
the project, a small house, which will later serve as a small restaurant and
meeting place. We are working hard to complete.                                  


Our Source:We have enclosed a small water supply source that has a reservoir of
almost 18.000 liters and with which we can supply the house and still planned
buildings and swimming facilities without electricity, using only the force of
gravity.
                                                                    


We will also use water turbines, because the island life is to be
supplied with electrical energy by way absolutely self-sufficient. With this an
enclosed source, we can provide without side effects, up to 100 buildings with
clean spring water.
Multiple Use:A portion of the spring water we will conduct permanently by the
individual swimming and water basins, and the overflow of the water is then to
be used by the still to be built raised beds –where we want to draw organic
vegetables- are cast. Here we will create the beds so that water –after work-
flows back into the stream, and thus also a cycle is created.*************************************************************************************************The total capital requirement for
the project is U$S 600.000.-On this case U$S 15.000.- for the completion of the house and the
surrounding paths.For the creation of a swimming pool of U$S 5.000.-For the installation of new water lines and the construction of 10
raised beds U$S 15.000.-U$S 15.000 for the purchase and installation of water turbines.For the construction of five guesthouses are needed U$S 150.000.-For the purchase of a further 110 hectares, of which will be also
reforested, are required U$S 250.000.-To cover wages and the small demand, such as the collecting of seeds and
breeding of trees for the next 1-2 years, U$S 150.000.-************************************************************************************************
Alternative:What happens if we do not reach our goal, and the U$S 600.000 do not get
along?Except that the project creates a longer path for further completion, nothing else happens.This project is not just money that is needed. It lives by the people already involved and will continue to live and grow. Only just a little slower.
***********************************************************************Our Thank You Bueffet : 

We give about rich Each a small Thank You . This is can be used from a little card that is redeemable for holiday.

However, the vouchers are also collectible . And if Someone vouchers from more than U.S. $ 5.000, - has , he may redeem them for a small building plot on the edge of the island life . Hence we have an extra at the foot of the hill country 12 plots of building land of 25 x 25 meters , so divided 625 sqm.

Who vouchers from more than U.S. $ 7.000, - has collected that can redeem them against a land plot on the edge of the island life , on the upper mountain national border to the island life . Here we have another 18 plots of building land of 25 x 25 meters so divided 625 sqm.

For the absolute nature loving helpers:

Who U.S. $ 20.000, - or donates more , or vouchers of more than U.S. $ 20,000 - has collected, the land gets a dierekt within the nature reserve , in the woods . Absolutely individually .
Here, however, can only 6 parcels on GROUND (99 years) will be awarded.

The GROUND is entered and guarantees in the land registry and can be traded and passed on.



After the addition of the other Buy hectares, Everyone gets the more than U.S. $ 5.000, - has Donated, or for more than U.S. $ 5.000, - Vouchers collected, gets a land base within, the then 120-acre island life. Of course, we pay attention to the possibility of a good access and walkability. For each land a 5-meter wide access road will be built.

Who, more than $ 5,000 - Donated or has collected of vouchers that can redeem them on demand against several land parcels.

We can total vouchers of $ 1.200,000, - forgive.

We can forgive a total of 240 plots of building land.

http://www.LIFEANDBEING.NET

************************************************************************************************

GERMAN                              Link  english  *******  Link german
DEUTSCH 
Die Lebensinsel in Paraguay.in der DU leben und SEIN
kannst wie Du bist, oder wie Du sein moechtest, ist wie eine Oase auf einem
kleinen Berg in Paraguay, die Du einerseits als Urlaubs-und Erholungsziel, oder
gar –wenn Du das moechtest auch als deinen Altersruhesitz nutzen kannst.
Keine (reine) Urlaubsinsel!Menschen benötigen zwar
zeitlich begrenzte Inseln um zur inneren Ruhe und zur Ausgeglichenheit zu
finden. Doch hier soll und darf Jeder dauernd so sein wie er sein möchte, oder
ist. Gleichzeitig soll diese LEBENSINSEL als Stiftung der Umwelt gerecht
werden, in der Menschen, Tiere und Pflanzen miteinander Leben und sein koennen.
Wie es begann:Im Jahr 2008 wurde ich durch
eine innere Stimme, durch meine Stimme die immer mit meinem hoeheren Selbst in
Verbindung steht, nach Paraguay gefuehrt. Heraus aus der wirtschaftlichen Welt
das Geld verdienen in ein Land, etwas groesser als Deutschland, mit nur knapp 6
Millionen Einwohner. Sehr schnell wurde klar, was ich hier sollte. Ein Land,
das von so vielen Menschen seit Jahrzehnten durch massenhaftes Urwald roden,
durch massenhaften Tierhaltung und andere landwirtschaftliche Projekte
missbraucht und vergewaltigt worden war. Hier sollte eine kleine Oase der
Stille, eine Oase der Ruhe, eine Oase innerhalb del Natur mit Pflanzen und
Tieren entstehen, die einerseits als positives Beispiel dienen kann und wird.
Anderseits aber auch uns Menschen das Recht und die Moeglichkeit einraeumt,
innerhalb del Natur und mit der Natur, leben und sein zu koennen. Meinem SEIN war es schon immer
zuwider, dass der Mensch in Stein-oder Betonburgen eingesperrt leben soll, und
das man die Welt zu einem gesperrten Naturparadies erklaeren will. Kommt doch
auch der Mensch aus del Natur und kann viel besser und gesuender leben in und
mit de Natur.
Neuorientierung:Eines war klar, das Land
erwartete eine Rueckgabe durch Wiederaufforstung, eine Wiedergutmachung und
Heilung. Und so wurde ein Berggrundstueck von 10 Hektar Groesse (100.000 qm),
welches fast vollstaendig gerodet war, gekauft.


SO SAH ES FAST UEBERALL AUF
DEM GRUNDSTUECK AUSKEINE PFLANZEN, KEINE BAEUME,
                                                                                                
NACH NUR EINEM JAHR
                                                                                               
Lokale Besonderheiten:Ja, das Anwesen hat eine
besondere Energie, und wer sich mit alten Zivilisationen beschaeftigt, der wird
bald herausfinden, warum es so viele alte Kulturen in die Berge zog. In den
Bergen, im Gestein, da wo die Erdschichten tausendfach gefaltet und durch
Erdbewegungen entstanden sind, ist eine hoehere Energie der Erde, eine hoehere
Schwingung im Erdgitternetz vorhanden. Das Grundstueck hat eine sehr hohe
Eigenschwingung.
Alte Wunden:Aber was meinem Herzen
besonders weh tat, war die Tatsache, dass es einmal auf diesem Berg- und
Quellgrundstueck so viele Quellen gab, die alle versiegt waren. Wir fanden zum
Beweis der segensreichen Wasservergangenheit zahlreiche Schluchten, wo sich das
Wasser ueber Jahrtausende Rinnen bis zu 20 Meter Tiefe in den Boden und in den
Felsen geschliffen hatte. Und ich sah in meiner Vision wieder Millionen von
Litern Wasser die wieder aus den Bergquellen sprudeln wuerden, wenn wir
Menschen us dieser gequaelten Erde annehmen wuerden.

                                                                                                                  
Heilungsprozess:Gesagt, getan, alles lief wie
von Geisterhand gesteuert. Wir haben den Wasserfluss der noch vorhanden Quellen
nach einer Trockenzeit von 3 Monaten im Jahren 2009 ausgemessen und kamen dabei
auf 86.5000 Litern pro Tag.Eine Freundin und ich legten
unser Geld in eine gemeinsame Kasse, wir erwarben das Grundstueck relativ
teuer. Aber der Ruf, uns selbst als Mensch und unseren Nachkommen zu helfen
–eine bessere Welt zu erschaffen- war so stark, dass wir einfach in dieses
Projekt einsteigen mussten. Wir fingen sofort an, tausende Baeume zu pflanzen.
Hierzu beauftragten wir einheimische paraguayer uns gegen einen vernuenftigen
Lohn, Samen von einheimischen kostbaren und edlen Baeumen zu sammeln, aus denen
wir mehr als 10.000 junge Baeume zogen die wir zum Grossteil selbst
einpflanzten.Hinzu kommt dass wir weitere
Kulturpflanzen auf dem Grundstueck asubrachten, um dort eine neue Waldkultur
entstehen zu lassen, die es ermoeglicht, innerhalb der Natur und mit der Natur
zu leben.
                            
Heute, nach fast 5 jaehriger
Arbeit, fliessen durch die gemeinsam investierte Arbeit und Zeit, innerhalb
eines Tages wieder mehr als 6 Millionen Liter (6.000 m³) Quellwasser aus dem
Grundstueck heraus!. Ausgemessen im Jahre 2012 auf 2013 nach 3,5 Monaten ohne
Regen.


EINE KLEINE QUELLE DIE IN 12
STUNDEN 18.000 LITER WASSER ERZEUGT,

das Land durch Wiederaufforstung und Waldwirtschaft zu gestalten. Deshalb wird
ueberwiegend nur Tierhaltung sowie Zuckerrohr- und Sojaanbau betrieben, womit
ziemlich schnell Geld verdient wird, und damit Raubbau an der Natur begangen. Deshalb ist es unser Anliegen, mit unserem Projekt, die Menschen auch aufzuklaeren, und Ihnen mit Rat und Tat zur Seite zu stehen. Hierfuer haben wir extra am Fusse des Berggrundstueckes 12 Bauland Parzellen von 25 x 25 Metern, also 625 qm abgeteilt.Wer Gutscheine von mehr als US$ 7.000,- gesammelt hat, der kann diese einloesen gegen eine Bauland Parzelle am Rande der Lebensinsel, an der oberen Grundstuecksgrenze zur Lebensinsel. Hier haben wir weitere 18 Bauland Parzellen von 25 x 25 Metern also 625 qm abgeteilt.Fuer die absolut Natur liebenden Helfer:Wer US$ 20.000,- oder mehr spendet, oder Gutscheine von mehr als US$ 20.000,- gesammelt hat, der bekommt eine Bauland Parzelle dierekt innerhalb des Naturschutzgebietes, im Wald. Absolut individuell. Hier koennen aber nur 6 Parzellen auf ERBPACHT ( 99 Jahre ) vergeben werden. Die ERBPACHT wird im Grundbuch eingetragen und garantiert und kann gehandelt und weiter gegeben werden.   Nach dem Hinzu Kaufen der anderen Hektaren, bekommt Jeder der mehr als US$ 5.000,- Gespendet hat, oder der mehr als fuer US$ 5.000,- Gutscheine gesammelt hat, eine Bauland Parzelle innerhalb, der dann 120 Hektar grossen Lebensinsel. Selbstverstaendlich achten wir auf die Moeglichkeit eines guten Zuganges und der Begehbarkeit. Zu jedem Bauland wird ein 5 Meter breiter Zugangsweg errichtet. Wer mehr als US$ 5.000,- Gespendet oder an Gutscheinen Gesammelt hat, der kann diese auf Wunsch gegen mehrere Bauland Parzellen eintauschen.Wir koennen insgesamt Gutscheine von US$ 1.200.000,- vergeben.Wir koennen insgesamt 240 Bauland Parzellen vergeben.                              Link  english  *******  Link german

story:
English

(Remember! You can donate as much as you want. Just click on "contribute now")

What I want to do and why?

Yasuni National Park, in Ecuador, is one of the most biologically diverse areas of the world. Largely unaffected by human activities, it supports an intact fauna of predators like jaguars or pumas, other large terrestrial mammals, at least 10 species of primates, many large birds, and thousands, if not millions, of other organisms. However, the park faces many threats. Oil exploitation, its direct and indirect effects like roads, illegal hunting and logging, habitat loss and wildlife trade, just to mention some, are just around the corner. Ironically, many of the threats that animals face come from the inhabitants of the park itself, due to lack of knowledge or misconceptions about the role of many species in the forest. This generates conflicts that could potentially threaten the coexistence of people and wildlife.

The goal of this, the first part of my project, is to obtain high quality pictures of ground mammals and birds that inhabit Yasuni´s forest, especially species that are elusive and hard to see, using high-resolution camera-traps. I know where and what to look for! Over the last few years I have been able to record over 60 species of mammals and ground birds with the help of camera-traps, obtaining very valuable information on their presence and use of habitat and making this information available through scientific papers. However, although regular camera traps are extremely useful for this purpose, the quality of the pictures is far from good for printing or publishing purposes. With high quality pictures my ultimate intention is to work on a book and other educational materials that can turn in a unique environmental tool to raise awareness and educate people in the local and global community about  the importance of protecting Yasuni´s wildlife. Above all, my goal is to reach the inhabitants of the park itself through material that is less scientific and has a more immediate impact on direct conservation.

What I want to do is to document the diversity and complexity of the exuberant life of Yasuní forest through pictures of real animals in their natural habitat. I think nothing tells better a story more effectively than images and I want to use the power of photos to promote conservation. I have extensive experience using camera traps and the eye required to capture a photograph that is truly meaningful to a viewer!. Humans have great capacity to change and destroy habitats and therefore to reduce the chances of species surviving. I am convinced that with the help of the book I intend to work on, these effects can be somehow reversed, enabling people to enjoy the beauty and diversity of species without harming them, in a beautiful, compelling, and emotionally connective way. I want to be able to connect viewers with their sense of responsibility to protect and conserve what we have left, and restore what we have lost.

Although Yasuní has a protected area status in paper, in reality eminent threats are getting closer and closer to the core of the park. The inhabitants of the park and the buffer area, both locals and indigenous, in some cases have never been able to witness their local wildlife. Despite the threats, the effort of the local authorities to stop indiscriminate killing and trade, apart from some isolated low success campaigns, has been limited or not existent at all. Many of the people I have talked to tell me that they have only seen animals like jaguars, ocelots or tapirs in bush markets or dead. If people don’t understand the importance and beauty of the forest and its wildlife, this will just keep going on. Despite the extensive research and effort to protect Yasuni, there have not been any formal education materials that can be distributed among local communities. My purpose is to show the message behind the research in a way that engages a broader audience, communicating the need to protect wild spaces.

There are many reasons to protect wildlife, from ecological to economic, legal, cultural, emotional, ethical or even religious approaches. However, these reasons have not promoted the conservation that is needed in Yasuní. I think it is vital to encourage people to have a better understanding of wildlife and its protection for conservation in any way possible. A book with pictures of real animals in their very own home will draw a new appreciation for wildlife from viewers of these images, making them aware of the importance to protect them and save them.

 

What am I going to do with the money?

Photographic equipment, in general, tends to be quite expensive. Your donations will help me to cover the cost of the equipment I need in order to obtain high quality pictures for the book. I am requesting your help to get three DSLR cameras with wide-angle lenses, a set of flashes for each camera, plus an extra set for my old Nikon that I also intend to use. Also, your donations will cover the cost of special active sensors needed to activate the cameras and flash cords and sensor cables that need to be custom made. I will also get all the materials I need to use to build cases for the cameras in order to protect them from the extreme weather conditions of the jungle (pelican boxes, PVC tubes, silicone, dissecant, etc). 

Thank you for your support!

 

En Español

(Recuerden, pueden donar la cantidad que deseen, solo hagan click en "contribute now")

Qué quiero hacer y por qué?

El Parque Nacional Yasuní, en Ecuador, es una de las áreas de mayor riqueza biológica del planeta.  Poco afectado por actividades humanas, el parque es hogar de grandes predadores como jaguares o pumas, otros mamíferos terrestres, al menos 10 especies de primates, muchísimas especies de aves y miles, sino millones, de otros organismos. Sin embargo, el parque enfrenta serias amenazas. La explotación petrolera y sus efectos directos e indirectos como carreteras, tala y cacería ilegal, perdida de hábitat y tráfico de vida silvestre están a la vuelta de la esquina. Irónicamente, muchas de las amenazas que enfrenta la vida silvestre de Yasuní provienen de sus mismos pobladores, por falta de conocimiento, mitos o percepciones erróneas sobre el papel de muchas de estas especies. Esto genera serios conflictos que potencialmente amenazan la convivencia pacífica entre humanos y vida silvestre.

La meta de esta, la primera parte de mi proyecto, es obtener fotografías de alta calidad de mamíferos y aves terrestres que habitan los bosques de Yasuní, especialmente especies que son elusivas y muy difíciles de ver, utilizando cámaras trampa de alta resolución. Sé qué buscar y donde! Durante los últimos años he registrado más de 60 especies de mamíferos y aves, obteniendo información invaluable sobre su distribución y el uso de hábitat. También he dado a conocer estos resultados a través de publicaciones científicas. Sin embargo, aunque las cámaras trampa típicas proveen información que es muy útil para propósitos científicos, la calidad de las fotografías está lejos de ser buena propósitos de impresión o publicación en un libro. Con fotografías de alta calidad, mi intención es trabajar en un libro y otros materiales educativos que puedan convertirse en una herramienta única para crear conciencia y educar a la comunidad local y global sobre la importancia de proteger la vida silvestre de Yasuní. Sobretodo, mi meta es llegar a los habitantes del mismo parque con un material que sea menos científico y más ilustrativo y que tenga un impacto más directo en la conservación.

Lo que quiero hacer es documentar la diversidad y complejidad de la exuberante vida de Yasuní a través de fotos de animales reales en su hábitat natural. Considero que nada cuenta una historia de manera más efectiva que las imágenes, y quiero usar el poder de la fotografía para promover la conservación. Tengo amplia experiencia utilizando cámaras trampa y el “ojo requerido” para capturar fotografías que tengan un verdadero significado en el observador. Los seres humanos tenemos una gran capacidad de alterar hábitats y de reducir las oportunidades de que las especies sobrevivan. Estoy convencido de que con la ayuda del libro en el que pretendo trabajar, estos efectos pueden verse reducidos, logrando que las personas disfruten la belleza y la diversidad de especies sin causarles daño, de una manera que los conecte emocionalmente. Quiero descubrir en la audiencia el sentido de responsabilidad de proteger y conservar lo que nos queda y de restaurar lo que ya hemos perdido.

Aunque Yasuní es una área protegida en papel, la realidad es que las amenazas están cada vez mas cerca del núcleo del parque. Sus habitantes, tanto colonos como indígenas, en muchos casos nunca han visto con sus propios ojos de la fauna del lugar. A pesar de las amenazas, el esfuerzo de las autoridades locales para detener la caza indiscriminada y el comercio de animales, aparte de uno que otro material o campaña de poco éxito, ha sido prácticamente inexistente. Mucha de la gente con la que hablado me ha contado que sólo han visto animales como jaguares, tigrillos o tapires, muertos o en mercados ilegales de fauna silvestre. Si la gente no comprende la importancia y la belleza del bosque y su fauna, esto simplemente continuará. A pesar de la extensa investigación y esfuerzos para proteger Yasuní, no existen materiales educativos que puedan distribuirse entre las comunidades locales. Mi propósito es mostrar el mensaje detrás de la investigación de manera que atraiga mas gente, comunicando la necesidad de proteger espacios para la vida silvestre.

Existen muchas razones para proteger la vida silvestre, desde el punto de vista económico, legal, cultural, emocional, ético o incluso religioso. No obstante, estos acercamientos no han sido suficientes para promover la conservación que se necesita en Yasuní. Considero que es vital alentar a la gente, de cualquier forma posible, a que entienda mejor el porqué conservar la vida silvestre. Un libro con fotos reales de animales libres y en su propio hábitat natural llamará la atención de la audiencia, especialmente la que convive con ellos, sobre la importancia de protegerlos y salvarlos.

 Qué voy a hacer con el dinero?

El equipo fotográfico, en general, tiende a ser muy caro. Sus donaciones me ayudarán a cubrir el costo del equipo que necesito para obtener fotografías de alta calidad para el libro. Con su ayuda podré adquirir tres cámaras digitales DSLR con lentes gran angulares, un juego de flashes para cada cámara y uno extra para mi vieja cámara Nikon, que también planeo utilizar. Sus donaciones también me ayudarán a cubrir el costo de sensores especiales requeridos para activar las cámaras y cables para flashes y sensores que necesitan ser fabricados a la medida. También me ayudarán a obtener el material que necesito para construir cajas especiales para proteger el equipo del inclemente clima de la selva. (cajas de plástico, PVC, silicona, etc.)

Muchas gracias por su ayuda!!!!!
