story:
"The silencing of the rainforests is a double deforestation, not only of trees but a deforestation of the mind's music, medicine and knowledge." 

Jay Griffiths


THE PROMISE

I made this promise 8 months ago, as I was leaving the Peruvian Amazon filled with gratitude for the rainforest and its people.

I had just been healed.

Stunned by the Amazon’s immense beauty but also struck by its savage devastation, I made a promise to return, to help Heal the Healer in return.

Fact is our greatest biological treasure on earth is being destroyed at a heart breaking rate to serve our modern world’s unsustainable demands.

source: Amazon Gold Mining: Behold The Devastation

At first I didn’t know how to fulfil my promise. How can one person help the world’s largest rainforest?

Truth is the vehicle of change is global awareness. For the destruction to end, the world needs to know what’s happening in the Amazon.

After months of savings, researching, planning, I'm ready to fulfil my promise.

With your help,

I will cross the whole of the Amazon by Boat.

4000 miles, 4 months, 3 rainforest conservation projects. 

I ask you to jump on board. Through rain and shine we will cross from Peru to Ecuador, and from Colombia to the end of the river in Brazil. Mile by mile, I will share with you the rainforest’s beauty but also its destruction from the inside.

The goal of my journey is to inspire people to make changes in their own lives that help reduce deforestation, to push corporations to adopt zero deforestation policies and to demand that governments create laws that reduce devastation and promote genuine conservation.

I ask you to share this journey with others, to spread the message and help Heal the Healer together.

You may wonder how I found myself in the Amazon in the first place, so let’s rewind back a bit…


THE STORY BEHIND

On a boat in the Amazon

Until about a year ago, I walked a fairly conventional path – uni, a series of jobs, my own design business in a big city. That’s when I asked myself:

Is my life sustainable for myself and the planet?

The inconvenient truth was right in my face. No, there was nothing sustainable in working long hours often serving a system I did not believe was serving any good, so I can pay a huge rent for a tiny space, accumulating stress of unfulfillment, only to release it through undeniably unhealthy habits so I can... go back to work.

Without a second thought I gave away my stuff, quit my flat, and with a backpack and a camera, I left the big city. Without really knowing where I'm going, but feeling sure I'm going where I'm supposed to go, I embarked on a mission:

To learn what it is to Live Sustainably.

Hiking the Manu region

The road lead me to volunteer at eco villages, transformational festivals, healing places and most importantly, outside in nature. Along this journey I learnt more than I had learnt in the past 15 years living in big cities. I learnt how life can be outside the systems we take for granted, how to live with much less stuff, how to plant food, manage my waste, build ecologically, work with nature and how to connect with people on a new, real level. Along this journey I took notes, many notes, photographs and videos. 

I felt the need to share the news so I started writing this blog:

A JOURNEY TO SUSTAINABILITY

Within 6 months a couple of thousands of people from 55 countries around the world visited it and many initiated conversations on health, the environment, and sustainability.

It was along this journey that I found myself in the Peruvian Amazon. The rainforest is buzzing. Life is thriving in every scale. Insects, butterflies, birds, animals, people, coexist symbiotically with the forest. 

But the rainforest is not only a majestic ecosystem. It's a living pharmacy.

Amazonian healing plant: Piñon blanco

The medicinal value of the Amazonian plants is just beginning to become known in the rest of the world, but for the indigenous people it’s a sacred knowledge they hold for millennia. Thousands of travellers are healed every year in the Amazon and I am one of them.

So, 1 year, 5 countries, 3 ecovillages, countless life lessons, immense healing and thousands of mosquito bites later, I'm returning to the Amazon to fulfil my promise, because there can't be sustainable life without the rainforest. 


MY JOURNEY - OUR MISSION


1st stop: PERU

We will start in the Peruvian Amazon, in Iquitos, where I will volunteer for a month at the Amazon Animal Orphanage & Pilpintuwasi Butterfly Farm, a non profit organization protecting animals affected by the poaching and trafficking industry.

Despite being an official rescue centre recognised by the government and supporting the wildlife police in their efforts against wildlife crime, Pilpintuwasi receives no funding and relies on the support of donations, sponsorship and volunteers.

From Iquitos, we will jump on a boat to Ecuador.

2nd stop: ECUADOR

In Ecuador, I will get off at Quito where I will volunteer for a month at the Ceiba Foundation for Tropical Conservation, reforesting abandoned pastures with native tree species. Ceiba is dedicated to conservation of tropical ecosystems, and works with local people to protect natural resources and develop sustainable ways of living. 

From Ecuador, we will cross to Colombia.

3rd stop: COLOMBIA

Our long boat ride in the rainforest starts here. For about two weeks I will be travelling on the waters of the Amazon river. I will be sleeping in a hammock on the deck documenting the journey along the way. 

4th stop: BRAZIL

I will get off the boat at Manaus to go to Oiyakaha, where I will volunteer for a month in ecological constructions and reforesting. Oiyakaha is situated 125km north of Manaus and is contributing to the development of solutions for the humanitarian and ecological needs of the Amazon. Its objective is to promote and develop ecologically sound and healthy living.

Our ride will finish at the mouth of the Amazon river, in Belem, Atlantic Ocean. But our mission will be just beginning to save this majestic place.


THE MAJESTIC PLACE

The Amazon Basin is immense. 

It contains 20% of the world's fresh water and covers almost 7 million square kilometres spanning across eight countries, Brazil, Bolivia, Peru, Ecuador, Colombia, Venezuela, Guyana and Suriname.

source: Rodrigo ABD 

In this basin lie the Amazon rainforest, a 5.5 million square kilometres of dense tropical forest, the largest and most species rich in the world. The rainforest has been in existence for at least 55 million years. 

source: infobrasile

For millennia, hundreds of indigenous tribes have been thriving in this majestic place, living symbiotically with the rainforest.

source: dailymail

THE DESTRUCTION

“Every two seconds, across the world, an area of forest the size of a football field is clear-cut by illegal loggers.” 


Until about 100 years ago, rainforests covered 14% of the earth's land surface. Now they cover only 6% and experts estimate that the last remaining rainforests could be consumed in less than 40 years.



source: Brent Stirton

The Amazon rainforest is vanishing at a rate of 20,000 square miles a year. It’s being cleared by chainsaws, bulldozers and fires for its timber value and then is followed by mining, farming and ranching operations, even by world giants like Mitsubishi Corporation, Gerogia Pacific, Texaco and Unocal.

source: Greenpeace

About 20% of the Amazon rainforest has been destroyed in the last 30 years, leading to murderings and massive displacements of native people, extinction of tens of thousands of species and huge carbon emissions. 

Evacuation of the Kayapo tribe in the Brazilian Amazon

Google recently released a devastating timelapse of 40 Years of Environmental Destruction in the Amazon. Studies have shown than a staggering 80% of all logging in the rainforest is illegal. Because of the density and vastness of the Amazon, illegal loggers are incredibly difficult to track. But not impossible.  Last year, Greenpeace activists used GPS tracking technology to expose illegal logging in Brazil, and recently the Amazon Basin Conservation Association (ACA) partnered with Wake Forest University on a mission to use drones to monitor and track illegal logging.

However, the scenarios for 2050 predict that more than half of the rainforest will be forever gone. Hundreds of plant and animal species, and indigenous tribes, will be forever gone with it.

Predicted scenario for 2050 Source : Amazon rainforest before and after

The rainforest is shrinking day by day. But the global movement fighting for its protection is growing fast. I'm part of it, and I'm urging you to jump on board.


THE WORTH FOR YOU

Even if you live on the other side of the world, the destruction of the Amazon rainforest affects your life:


The air you breath is changing

The Amazon Rainforest has been described as the “Lungs of our Planet” because it provides the essential environmental world service of continuously recycling carbon dioxide into oxygen.

More than 20% of the world’s oxygen is produced in the Amazon Rainforest.

Furthermore, deforestation is the 2nd highest and fastest growing contributor to carbon emissions and global climate change. 


The chain you are part of is breaking

source: Greenbuzz

A very large number of Amazonian plant and animal species are "endemic", meaning that they are found there and nowhere else. Extensive deforestation, particularly in Brazil, is leading to the extinction of known and unknown species, reducing biological diversity and adversely impacting soil, water, and air quality.

Fact is, we are losing 137 plant, animal and insect species every day due to deforestation; that equates to 50,000 species a year.


Your fellow humans are being threatened

Shipibo child in the Amazon, source: Irene Shamma

Five hundred years ago, an estimated ten million Indians lived in the Amazon rainforest. Today, fewer than 700,000 survive. 

This not only is the destruction of people, but of their cultures, and accumulated knowledge, including that of medicinal plants.


Your real medicines are disappearing

source: stevenfoster.com

As the rainforest species and indigenous cultures disappear, so do many possible cures for life-threatening diseases. While 25% of Western pharmaceuticals are derived from rainforest ingredients, less than 1% of these tropical trees and plants have been tested by scientists. 

Most medicine men and women and shamans remaining in the Amazon Rainforest are 70 years old or more. Each time one dies, a vast body of knowledge is lost. Most of the shamans today do not have apprentices. That is thousands of years of accumulated medicinal knowledge that come completely and irreversibly to an end.


HELP HEAL THE HEALER

Friends. 

The Amazon rainforest is our greatest Healer. Thriving for 55 million years, generously offering us clean water, air, food and medicines. We can't let its savage destruction continue. Because if it does, this majestic place will soon be gone. And the future generations will look back and wonder why we let it happen.

We need to Heal the Healer before it's too late.

I'm donating my own time and money to fulfill my promise to the Amazon and bring this mission to life.

I'm personally covering my flights to and from South America, insurance, gear and food.


I need your help for:

  1. River and road transportation: 650 EUR (minimum amount to cross all four countries)
  2. Accommodation and food at the conservation projects:
  • Peru,  Amazon Animal Orphanage & Pilpintuwasi Butterfly Farm: 450 EUR (minimum expenses for one month)
  • Ecuador, Ceiba Foundation for Tropical Conservation: 450 EUR (minimum expenses for one month)
  • Brazil, Oiyakaha: 450 EUR (minimum expenses for one month)

    3. Your rewards: 500 EUR

    

     TOTAL 2500 EUR


ALL YOUR HELP WILL GO TO THE AMAZON. If we exceed our goal, I WILL EXTEND MY MISSION AND VOLUNTEERING WORK IN THE AMAZON as well as sharing the journey with you, for as long as your help allows me to. Who knows, if enough people get to help, we may get to cross the rainforest all the way back upstream!


LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN 

Every little bit helps. Please contribute, show your support, jump on board!

If you can't contribute with money, you can still contribute with love. :)

  • Please Spread the message, tell people what's happening to the rainforests.
  • Please like/share my campaign on facebook 
  • Have you volunteered in the Amazon before? Any tips?
  • Have you traveled in the Amazon by boat? I need your advice on routes and boats! 
  • Do you wanna join forces on this mission to save the Amazon? Contact me!


10 OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP HEAL THE HEALER


Say NO to palm oil. 

Palm oil, found in half of all processed foods, is a key contributor to rainforest deforestation. Read your food and beauty product labels carefully, and avoid this ingredient. 

Brazilian Music, Si, Brazilian Beef, No!

 60-70% of deforestation in the Brazilian Amazon results from cattle ranching. Brazil is the world’s 2nd largest beef exporter.

Teach Your Children.

Teach kids about the importance of rainforests to the health of our planet. Empower them to make responsible choices.

Furnish Wisely.

Avoid furniture and other products made from threatened rainforest woods like: Mahogany, Rosewood and Ebony. Logging and the new roads it necessitates is a major driver of long term rainforest destruction.

Reduce Your Consumption of Fossil Fuels.

Oil extraction in the Amazon has increased dramatically with devastating social and environmental consequences. Approximately 70% of the entire Peruvian Amazon in now leased by oil companies.

Travel Green.

Ride your bike, take mass transit or carpool to work. Every little bit helps. If you travel to a rainforest area, make sure your tourist dollars support local communities who protect the local environment.

Be A Rainforest Friend.

Learn about and support the demarcation of indigenous lands. It has been proven that indigenous peoples are the best forest stewards. Read the World Resources Institute Report: Securing Rights, Combating Climate Change.


THANK YOU


THE SOURCES

Medicinehunter

SavetheAmazon

Rainforest Foundation

Wiki

Sciencedaily

Amazon Conservation

Amazon team

WWF

Rainforests mongabay
story_txt:
"The silencing of the
rainforests is a double deforestation, not only of trees but a deforestation of
the mind's music, medicine and knowledge." 
Jay Griffiths
THE PROMISE
I made this promise 8 months ago, as I was leaving the Peruvian Amazon
filled with gratitude for the rainforest and its people. 
I had just been healed.
Stunned by the Amazon’s immense beauty but also struck by its savage
devastation, I made a promise to return, to help Heal the Healer in return.
Fact is our greatest biological treasure on earth is being destroyed
at a heart breaking rate to
serve our modern world’s unsustainable demands.source: Amazon Gold Mining: Behold The Devastation

At first I didn’t know how to fulfil my promise. How can one person help
the world’s largest rainforest? 
Truth is the vehicle of change is global awareness. For the destruction to end, the world needs to know what’s happening in
the Amazon. 
After months of savings, researching, planning, I'm ready to fulfil my promise.
With your help,
I will cross the whole of the Amazon by Boat.

4000 miles, 4 months, 3 rainforest conservation projects. 
I ask you to jump on board. Through rain and shine we will cross from
Peru to Ecuador, and from Colombia to the end of the river in Brazil. Mile by mile, I will share with you the rainforest’s
beauty but also its destruction from the inside.
The goal of my journey is to inspire people to make changes in their
own lives that help reduce deforestation, to push corporations to adopt zero
deforestation policies and to demand that governments create laws that reduce
devastation and promote genuine conservation.
I ask you to share this journey with others, to spread the message and
help Heal the Healer together.
You may wonder how I found myself in the Amazon in the first place, so let’s
rewind back a bit…




THE STORY BEHIND








On a boat in the Amazon
Until about a year ago, I walked a fairly conventional path – uni, a
series of jobs, my own design business in a big city. That’s when I asked
myself:
Is my life sustainable for myself and the planet?
The inconvenient truth was right in my face. No, there was nothing
sustainable in working long hours often serving a system I did not believe was serving any good,
so I can pay a huge rent for a tiny space, accumulating stress of
unfulfillment, only to release it through undeniably unhealthy habits so I
can... go back to work.
Without a second thought I gave away my stuff, quit my flat, and with a
backpack and a camera, I left the big city. Without really knowing where I'm
going, but feeling sure I'm going where I'm supposed to go, I embarked on a
mission:

To learn what it is to Live Sustainably.


Hiking the Manu region
The road lead me to volunteer at eco villages, transformational
festivals, healing places and most importantly, outside in nature. Along this
journey I learnt more than I had learnt in the past 15 years living in big
cities. I learnt how life can be outside the systems we take for granted, how
to live with much less stuff, how to plant food, manage my waste, build
ecologically, work with nature and how to connect with people on a new, real
level. Along this journey I took notes, many notes, photographs and
videos. 
I felt the need to share the news so I started writing this blog:
A JOURNEY TO SUSTAINABILITY
Within 6 months a couple of thousands of people from 55 countries around
the world visited it and many initiated conversations on health, the
environment, and sustainability.
It was along this journey that I found myself in the Peruvian Amazon.
The rainforest is buzzing. Life is
thriving in every scale. Insects, butterflies, birds, animals, people, coexist
symbiotically with the forest. 
But the rainforest is not only a majestic ecosystem. It's a living
pharmacy.


Amazonian healing plant: Piñon blanco

The medicinal value of the Amazonian plants is just beginning to become
known in the rest of the world, but for the indigenous people it’s a sacred
knowledge they hold for millennia. Thousands of travellers are healed every
year in the Amazon and I am one of them.

So, 1 year, 5
countries, 3 ecovillages, countless life lessons, immense healing and thousands
of mosquito bites later, I'm returning to the Amazon to fulfil my promise, because there can't be sustainable life without the rainforest. 



MY JOURNEY - OUR MISSION









1st stop: PERU

We will start in the Peruvian Amazon, in Iquitos, where I will volunteer for a month at the Amazon Animal Orphanage & Pilpintuwasi Butterfly Farm, a non profit
organization protecting animals affected by the poaching and trafficking
industry.
Despite being an official rescue centre recognised by the government and
supporting the wildlife police in their efforts against wildlife crime,
Pilpintuwasi receives no funding and relies on the support of donations,
sponsorship and volunteers.
From Iquitos, we will jump on a boat to Ecuador.






2nd stop: ECUADOR

In Ecuador, I will get off at Quito where I will volunteer for a month at the Ceiba Foundation for Tropical Conservation, reforesting abandoned pastures with native tree species. Ceiba is dedicated to conservation of tropical ecosystems, and works with local people to protect natural resources and develop sustainable ways of living. 
From Ecuador, we will cross to Colombia.
3rd stop: COLOMBIA
Our long boat ride in the rainforest starts here. For about two weeks I will be travelling on the waters of the Amazon river. I will be sleeping in a hammock on the deck documenting the journey along the way. 

4th stop: BRAZIL

I will get
off the boat at Manaus to go to Oiyakaha, where I will volunteer for a month in ecological constructions and reforesting. Oiyakaha is situated 125km north of
Manaus and is contributing to the development of solutions for the humanitarian
and ecological needs of the Amazon. Its objective is to promote and develop
ecologically sound and healthy living.
Our ride will finish at the mouth of the Amazon river, in Belem, Atlantic Ocean. But our mission will be just beginning to save
this majestic place.








THE MAJESTIC PLACE

The Amazon Basin is immense.  
It contains 20% of the world's fresh water and covers almost 7
million square kilometres spanning across eight countries, Brazil, Bolivia,
Peru, Ecuador, Colombia, Venezuela, Guyana and Suriname.




source: Rodrigo ABD 

In this basin lie the Amazon rainforest, a 5.5 million square kilometres of dense tropical forest, the
largest and most species rich in the world. The rainforest has been in existence for at least 55 million years. 


source: infobrasile


For millennia, hundreds of indigenous tribes have been thriving in this majestic place, living symbiotically with the rainforest.


source: dailymail



THE DESTRUCTION




“Every two seconds, across the world, an area of forest the size of a football field is clear-cut by illegal loggers.” 




Until about 100 years ago, rainforests covered 14% of the earth's land surface. Now they cover only 6% and experts estimate that the last remaining rainforests could be consumed in less than 40 years.





source: Brent Stirton


The Amazon rainforest is vanishing
at a rate of 20,000 square miles a year. It’s being cleared by chainsaws, bulldozers and fires for its timber value and then is
followed by mining, farming and ranching operations, even by world giants like
Mitsubishi Corporation, Gerogia Pacific, Texaco and Unocal.



source: Greenpeace


About 20% of the Amazon rainforest has been
destroyed in the last 30 years, leading to murderings
and massive displacements of native people, extinction of tens of thousands of
species and huge carbon emissions. 



Evacuation of the Kayapo tribe in the Brazilian Amazon
Google recently released a devastating timelapse of 40 Years of Environmental Destruction in the Amazon. Studies have shown than a staggering 80% of all logging in the rainforest is illegal. Because of the density and vastness of the Amazon, illegal loggers are incredibly difficult to track. But not impossible.  Last year, Greenpeace activists used GPS tracking technology to expose illegal logging in Brazil, and recently the Amazon Basin Conservation Association (ACA) partnered with Wake Forest University on a mission to use drones to monitor and track illegal logging.
However, the scenarios for 2050 predict that more than half of the rainforest will be forever gone. Hundreds of plant and animal species, and indigenous tribes, will be forever gone with it.


Predicted scenario for 2050 Source : Amazon rainforest before and after

The rainforest is shrinking day by day. But the global movement fighting for its protection is growing fast. I'm part of it, and I'm urging you to jump on board.

Fact is, we are losing 137 plant, animal and insect species
every day due to deforestation; that equates to 50,000 species a year.

Shipibo child in the Amazon, source: Irene Shamma

This not only is the destruction of people, but of their cultures, and accumulated knowledge, including that of medicinal plants.

story:
When ORV Alguita was launched by Captain Charles Moore in Hobart in 1995  and sailed to Tasmania's rugged west coast on her first research voyage, no one knew that she would soon become the most pioneering, independent research vessel in the world. After completing 8 research expeditions, her job is far from complete... 


In July & August 2014, a research team led by Captain Charles Moore will embark on ORV Alguita on its 9th research voyage to the center of what is now known as the “Great Pacific Garbage Patch." 

"We will live in the center of this new plastic world aboard ORV Alguita. With a team of dynamic scientists, we will conduct an intensive 30-day exploration (sample water, fish and invertebrates) to determine the extent to which this habitat mimics a new inherently toxic coastline," commented Capt. Moore.


MEET THE EXPEDITION TEAM:

1) Jesus Reyes is President of the Pacific Coast Environmental Conservancy. He studies impacts on endocrine systems of wild fishes from human generated waste.

2) Lorena M. Rios is  Assistant Professor of Chemistry at University of Wisconsin Superior. She focuses on persistent organic pollutants (POPs) in sediments, tissues, water, and plastic debris, especially microplastics ingested by fish.

3) Laurie Harvey is a seabird ecologist and founder of Sutil Conservation Ecology.  Her main interest is the breeding biology and reproductive performance of seabirds. She specializes in project design and logistics to facilitate habitat restoration at remote island locations, and recently became a licensed captain.

4) Cynthia Matzke is now finishing her Master of Advanced Studies program at the Center for Marine Biodiversity and Conservation at Scripps Institution of Oceanography. Cynthia specializes in underwater photography of difficult to film marine mammals. She has experience in broadcast journalism for environmental issues.

5) Dale Selvam is a licensed captain with over a hundred and fifty thousand miles of voyaging, much of which was with marine scientists doing research on plastic pollution.  He was the first to lead expeditions that sampled the South Atlantic and South Pacific Garbage Patches.

6) Charles Moore is a licensed captain with over a hundred thousand miles sampling plastic pollution in the Pacific Ocean from Tasmania, Australia to the Oregon/California border.  His published papers, interviews and lectures, as well as his award winning book, Plastic Ocean, have brought international attention to the "Plastic Plague" in the world ocean. He will receive the Peter Benchly "Hero of the Seas" award from the Blue Frontier Campaign in San Francisco at the end of May. 


EQUIPMENT TO BE PURCHASED WITH YOUR GENEROUSITY:
Lo-Tek Sensors - depth and water temp (2) $500 each
Mini CTD - Conductivity, Salinity, Dissolved Oxygen $5,000
locator beacons to track debris - (3) $900
manta trawl replacement net - $500
Fabricate Manta Trawl (1 m x 20 cm) - $5,000
Fabricate Small Purse Seine Net - $10,000
Spare Batteries - $500
small freezers for marine life tissue samples - $400
markers, labels, jars - $300
Tucker Trawl - trawling for plastic at discreet depths - $8,000
Drone - Aerial search to locate debris - $4,000
ROV - Small underwater sub for photos - $1,500

CAPTAIN CHARLES MOORE IN THE MEDIA!

Captain Charles Moore's work has been highlighted in numerous major media outlets, including ABC’s Nightline, The Late Show with David Letterman, The Colbert Report, Good Morning America, TEDx, TedTalks, National Public Radio, Rolling Stone, and The Wall Street Journal. 

VIEW SOME VIDEOS BELOW AND THEN THE REST CAN BE FOUND HERE: http://www.alguita.com/#!media/c12m2




WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Operating in conjunction with non-profit, Algalita Marine Reserch Institute (AMRI) means that these voyages can be made possible by passionate philanthropists. We have the support of many influential and environmentally aware individuals, but we need YOUR financial help to spread the world about the state of our ocean and its inhabitants!

Ed Begley Jr. & Capt. Moore


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute right now, please support our research by doing the following:
  • Help us get the word out and tell your friends about Captain Moore's JULY/AUGUST 2014 EXPEDITION to "The Great Pacific Garbage Patch."
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

OH, JUST WHEN YOU THINK CAPT. MOORE COULDN'T GET ANY COOLER...

Capt. Moore even helps his land community any way he can. He's been harvesting a community garden for years and will be supplying his team of scientists on the JULY/AUGUST 2014 expedition with veggies and fruits from this Gladys Ave Urban Farm! Don't you want to support him and his team on their amazing endeavor to make our world a better place?

story:
25 YEARS STRONG! 

SOLIDARITY CAMPAIGN 

THE SOLUTION LIES IN THE SITUATION 

Last year we set out to increase our impact and renew our vision by funding the launch of the Drum Mobile! We did it!  Thanks to your generosity the DRUM MOBILE hit the road in 2015, building community and spreading the power of DRUMMING and HARMONIC LIVING throughout the United States. Through this outpouring of support we experienced how PEOPLE POWER can fuel our VISION! So this year, we are launching our 1st ANNUAL SOLIDARITY CAMPAIGN to raise $25,000! This campaign will keep the DRUM MOBILE moving across the United States, grow the work of SPIRIT DRUMZ and ensure HARMONIC LIVING becomes an embedded practice racial, environmental, and gender justice MOVEMENTS! 

WHY A SOLIDARITY CAMPAIGN?
Spirit Drumz has been inspiring community for 25 years with drumming, workshops, ritual and creating permaculture gardens. We have seen the POWER of community to MOBILIZE for transformation, and believe YOUR energy is need to keep the vision of HARMONIC LIVING moving. This year we are asking for your SOLIDARITY- financial, communal, and spiritual - to make SPIRIT DRUMZ a MOVEMENT! 

SPIRIT DRUMS OFFERINGS: We have BIG plans for 2016! 

Drumming

  • Using the DRUM MOBILE to provide free and Low Cost MOBILIZING COMMUNITY drumming workshops to under-resourced and disenfranchised CHILDREN, YOUTH AND ADULTS across the country
  • Group FunDRUMentals coaching classes, drum camps and tours
  • Youth Drum-Talk-Story school assemblies, classes, and leadership sessions for all levels, including university courses
  • Individual & group healing ceremonies – transitional rites of passage, purification, weddings, anniversaries

Harmonic Living- Land Project (Covington, Georgia)

  • Build a GREEN HOUSE with local students and community members 
  • Install a RAIN HARVEST SYSTEM and SOLAR POWER panels 
  • Work with partners to plant and maintain URBAN FOOD FORESTS across the United States
Leadership Development 
  • Launch the LEADING WITH HARMONIC LIVING institute to develop leaders to use drumming and permaculture principles to activate transformation. 
  • Private DrumLife coaching sessions for individual and small groups
  • Develop DRUM MOBILE Curriculum to allow for OPEN ACCESS to our resources. 

BENEFITS & OUTCOMES

Benefits 

  • Mobilize more communities with ample supplies for drumming events; craft natural instruments, create community gardens more efficiently, impact public actions and increase energy efficiency
  • Self-sustaining mobile space that transforms into a shop, community gathering space, rest area, design space with on-demand renewable resources and wifi
  • Short and long term residencies, drumming assemblies, workshops, performances and rituals; instrument-making and land restoration
  • ZERO Fossil Fuel, ZERO Waste and ZERO Violence!  

Outcomes 
  • Reduce our carbon foot print and end fossil fuel era
  • Nurture consciousness through drum medicine and earth wisdom
  • Increase economic resiliency for low income and POC communities
  • Cultivate food forests in local urban and rural settings
  • Harvest rain, sun, wind, & waste resources honorably
TIMELINE 2016
Jan - March- Fundraising  $25,000 to establish funding base line
March- Drum Mobile Tour from California to Georgia 
June - Drum Mobile Tour from Georgia to Canada 
July- September-  Local Urban Forest Development, Permaculture Workshops Drum- Talk - Story presentations,  in South Eastern  and Northeastern Region 
September - December - Launch of "Leading Through Harmonic Living  Institute" 
FUNDING & BUDGET

By raising at least l $25,000 we ensure SPIRIT DRUMZ has enough capital to  achieve the above programming and apply for other funding ( grants, sponsors, etc) and multiply your donation! 

Break Down of Costs

  • $10,000- Greenhouse, Rain Harvest System, Solar Power Panels
  • $3,500 - Annual Drum Mobile -  loan payment, insurance, maintenance 
  • $3,000 - Costs of  3 Youth Drum- Talk - Story 
  • $3,000 - Costs of  3  Permaculture Workshops 
  • $5, 500 - Costs of  1 "LEADING WITH HARMONIC LIVING" leadership institute 

JOIN THE SOLIDARITY CIRCLE!

Fuel Spirit Drumz for 2016. All donations tax deductible! 

  • Become a monthly Sustainer ($25-$250/month)!
  • Donate and receive our awesome perks!
  • OR donate any amount of money - every cent counts!

Don’t Have Cash?

There are still LOTS of ways to support. Help build our campaign, reduce overhead costs, add value, repurpose materials, and skill-share!
  • SHARE this campaign with your networks 
  • CONNECT us with matching grant donors
  • INVITE us to residencies in universities, schools, and communities
  • BOOK the Drum Mobile & donate items (contact for items list)
  • COORDINATE a workshop in your town, and participate for FREE!
  • JOIN our mailing list! 

Thank you for reading about our evolutionary vision - blessings - always, 

Afia Walking Tree 


Sponsors & Supporters

Thanks to our fiscal sponsor Women Drummers International!

 


Thanks to our first major sponsor Emerson Paradise Villas  for offering 3-day, and 5-day, accommodation passes to me in my homeland, Jamaica.


We are fortunate to have a great team of collaborators and colleagues Elizabeth Boubion, Copperwoman, Mary Owen, Barbara Jefferson, Laurie Lynn Hogan, Edwin Rodriguez, Larissa Montfort, Mar Stevens, Carolyn Hunt, Queen Hollins, Mercedes  Gibson, and many beloveds.

Learn About Spirit Drumz
story_txt:
25 YEARS STRONG! 

SOLIDARITY CAMPAIGN 
THE SOLUTION LIES IN THE SITUATION 

Last year we set out to increase our impact and renew our vision by funding the launch of the Drum Mobile! We did it!  Thanks to your generosity the DRUM MOBILE hit the road in 2015, building community and spreading the power of DRUMMING and HARMONIC LIVING throughout the United States. Through this outpouring of support we experienced how PEOPLE POWER can fuel our VISION! So this year, we are launching our 1st ANNUAL SOLIDARITY CAMPAIGN to raise $25,000! This campaign will keep the DRUM MOBILE moving across the United States, grow the work of SPIRIT DRUMZ and ensure HARMONIC LIVING becomes an embedded practice racial, environmental, and gender justice MOVEMENTS! 


WHY A SOLIDARITY CAMPAIGN?

Spirit Drumz has been inspiring community for 25 years with drumming, workshops, ritual and creating permaculture gardens. We have seen the POWER of community to MOBILIZE for transformation, and believe YOUR energy is need to keep the vision of HARMONIC LIVING moving. This year we are asking for your SOLIDARITY- financial, communal, and spiritual - to make SPIRIT DRUMZ a MOVEMENT! 

SPIRIT DRUMS OFFERINGS: We have BIG plans for 2016! 
Drumming


Using the DRUM MOBILE to provide free and Low Cost MOBILIZING COMMUNITY drumming workshops to under-resourced and disenfranchised CHILDREN, YOUTH AND ADULTS across the country
Group FunDRUMentals coaching classes, drum camps and tours
Youth Drum-Talk-Story school assemblies, classes, and leadership sessions for all levels, including university courses
Individual & group healing ceremonies – transitional rites of passage, purification, weddings, anniversaries

Harmonic Living- Land Project (Covington, Georgia)

Build a GREEN HOUSE with local students and community members 
Install a RAIN HARVEST SYSTEM and SOLAR POWER panels 
Work with partners to plant and maintain URBAN FOOD FORESTS across the United States

Launch the LEADING WITH HARMONIC LIVING institute to develop leaders to use drumming and permaculture principles to activate transformation.

Nurture consciousness through drum medicine and earth wisdom

Increase economic resiliency for low income and POC communities

Cultivate food forests in local urban and rural settings


Harvest rain, sun, wind, & waste resources honorably

story:
UPDATE: I have succeeded in my fundraising and will be able to compete! Thank you all so much for your support - those though this site and those in person! I wouldn't be able to compete without your help and having his opportunity means a great deal to me! Again, thank you so much for all your support - I'll make you all proud! 

If anybody is interested in attending the Pageant, it will be held on Sept. 1st at the Ala Moana Hotel followed shortly by the Miss Earth USA Pageant. Tickets are $45 dollars and include access to both shows! I'm selling some personally so you can e-mail me at rpershin@hawaii.edu if you can come down and cheer me on!

 

 

 

PLEASE NO MORE DONATIONS! I HAVE SUCCEEDED IN RAISING MY FULL $600! THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!

Aloha family and friends!

I have recently been invited to compete in the first annual Miss Earth Hawaii competition where if successful, I will represent Hawaii in a nationwide and possibly international competition that highlights Environmental Awareness and Sustainability. Miss Earth is an awesome platform on which to advocate for international cooperation in environmental sustainability.  Miss Earth pageants are overshadowed by the Miss World and Miss Universe titles, but I strongly believe that with great fame comes great responsibility. Why not take this opportunity for world-wide attention and direct it towards a crucial cause?

I’m asking for your support so that I can participate in this amazing opportunity to help create real interest and enthusiasm for protecting our natural world!

 

Moments like this remind me what it is we're fighting to protect!   Remember: We're in THEIR home - no touching please!

Me & My Goal:

A quick bit about me: Born and raised here on O’ahu, I am 23 years old and studying Natural Resources and Environmental Management (NREM) at the University of Hawaii. I have lots of experience (and tons of fun) working with young children and I believe in getting people interested in their earth’s systems and resources at an early age.

To me, young girls being exposed to information about environmental issues through beauty pageants is an extraordinary concept! While most pageants involve a talent portion, the Miss Earth judges instead interview contestants as to their basic knowledge of environmental concerns today, as well as their specific platforms or causes. 

What I Need:

Here’s my dilemma folks! I have unlimited resources at my disposal for research, study, and speaking material due to our great sources at UH. However, being a broke college student – I have no means of acquiring $600 that will cover the basic costs of the pageant: 

$350 – Entrance Fee

$250 - Required Interview Attire/Evening Gown

I regret that I do not have the financial means to provide many fun perks for my sponsors –funds raised will determine whether or not I will compete at all.

If I am unsuccessful in raising the full amount, the funding I have received will first go towards covering the $350 entrance fee. Should I raise an amount over my $600 goal, the remainder will be donated to the Hawaii Conservation Alliance. 

MY PLATFORM:

“The greatest danger to our future is apathy.” – Jane Goodall.

I firmly believe that the greatest environmental concern that we face as a global population today is the disconnect between our natural world and our corporate world. As the bridge between these two worlds, humans ought to be thoroughly informed about issues regarding their environment and natural resources. Yet many are not. Blame for this should lay on the shoulders of mainstream media and local and federal governments or entities – not the people themselves.

Last spring, I along with a group of peers was required to execute a project that: Created and added a Research Guide for Environmental Resources on SBCC’s Library website: http://library.sbcc.edu/findsearch/research-guides/sustainability-resources/

Our project included obtaining agreements with English 110 teachers resulting in a minimum of 1,000 college students researching and reporting on environmental issues of their choice. 

Creating an educated, informed general public is a SURE-FIRE for us as a global population to see way to see some progress in the preservation of our natural world and the resources that depend on it.  Which is why I want to be the next Miss Earth – to be an Ambassador of the Environment and create the interest it deserves.

story:
What is the Pono Project?

While many groups work to save special places (and we'll do that too!), we are also working to SAVE CONSERVATIONISTS!

The Hawaiian word “Pono” means to do what is right and we are “doing right by conservation."

The Pono Project uses a new approach to bridge the gap between donors and the conservation organizations they fund. And that means ALL donors - big or small!

Our goal is to get more money to deserving conservationists while making the grantmaking process simpler and easier, with reports that will be WATCHED instead of a 10 page paper report that gets filed away. Click on the "Gallery" tab at the top to view a sample video report from the East and West Maui Watershed Partnerships!

The Pono Project is a portal for “one stop donating” where groups can submit simplified proposals for environmental projects which are reviewed by a panel of experts who choose a subset of noteworthy and innovative projects that we are interested in funding.

Then, and this is the EXCITING PART, we crowd source public opinion to let YOU decide which of the top projects will be funded. Currently, only large donors get to choose which projects they think are important. With the new Pono Project method, every donor gets a vote! 

Every donor can save a conservationist - whether its saving them time, money or their sanity!

We are changing the paradigm to not only let donors choose where their money goes, but also to get Projects that are up for funding to interact with the public via social media, and in the process, the Pono Project learns from its voters about why people donate and what projects they think are important, thereby cultivating interactive and longer term donors for the future.

So... the Pono Project is:

1. SAVING CONSERVATIONISTS!
2. One Stop Donating to evaluated organizations
3. Crowd Sourcing - Vote on the next Environmental Idol!
4. A funder of important conservation efforts
5. An art house of film, photography and social media for conservation efforts

"With tourism and our population growth, conservation will continue to be a priority. It is important to mediate that growth with comparable protections for our natural environment... The partnerships envisioned by the Pono Project can be an important investment in the sustainable future of our islands."      
~ U.S. Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard

 

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous contribution will help to continue our efforts to build this new way of funding by developing the web and social media tools that will be needed to maintain the voting and video presence for all of our potential projects. We will be implementing website upgrades and creating new social media channels and our first blog.  We will be building new online tools for our "Environmental Idol" voting sessions, and ways to track and interact with individual donors in new ways. A new option on our upgraded website will include opportunities to get your hands dirty with some of the organizations that we fund, highlighting volunteer opportunities in your area.

Your support will also go towards significant logistical and operational needs such as outreach and marketing of this new idea to potential funders, donors and partners, in order to build the foundation of funds that will be distributed to noteworthy conservation projects. It will also contribute to the development of grantmaking protocols and media necessary to maintain our new form of reporting. With the new online and marketing tools, we will strengthen the groundswell of support that we will need to also bring in large donors and partner companies that will sustain this Project in the long run.

 

What makes us different?

***What sets us apart from other similar organizations is not only our committment to putting the people first, but also our desire to work within social media, film and outreach to better connect the groups that we sponsor to the world and to make the granting process simple, fun and rewarding, instead of a burden.***

Donations to the Pono Project are distributed to the hard-working conservation organizations that are chosen by our voting polls, and a portion also goes towards building outreach and social media materials (videos, photo shoots and social media campaigns) that will showcase each of the organizations we fund, as a new means of "video reporting," alleviating some of the tedious paperwork that is involved in the grant process.

"We are excited at the prospect of what the Pono Project will be bringing to Hawaii."

Clifford Morden - Deputy Director, PCSU - University of Hawaii

Why should I donate to this campaign?

To SAVE A CONSERVATIONIST! And because being "Pono" is important!

If we were really doing "what is right" for conservation, we would be helping organizations to spend more time doing what they do best - protecting the places we love.

In every way, we will strive to create long-term, sustainable jobs for local communities, give them the tools they need to educate the public about their mission, and support them financially and logistically throughout the whole process.

"The Pono Project's reliable and consistent stream of funding will create or maintain local jobs, provide educational opportunities for our communities and visitors, and preserve the functions of our natural environment that keep our water, land and air clean and inviting."

~ Maui County Council Chair - Gladys Baisa

 

The Pono Project is setup to be a world-wide effort and can be helpful anywhere. Our first Pono Project site is where the spirit of Pono was born - Hawai‘i. 

Simplicity will be our mantra - with 2 page grant applications and reporting protocols that involve site visits by our staff to film, photograph and interview the crews of the organizations we fund, in order to make their final reports more interactive and visual.

We believe deeply in the Pono Project -- we have gladly invested ourselves in this project and we are turning to you to ask for a contribution to help launch this great new idea.

 

"[The Pono Project] will provide an opportunity for greater leverage and collaboration among various conservation land management entities and create a new, single voice to increase the level of funding, public support, and conservation management on the ground."

~ The Maui Conservation Alliance

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give - SHARE!

The Pono Project builds success by building our audience - tell your family, neighbors, colleagues, community groups, church friends, dog walkers and your mailman how they can donate and vote on who gets the money!

When you travel, tell your concierge that you want to stay at hotels that support the Pono Project.

When you shop, tell your store clerks that the Pono Project can be their "charity of choice" for the year. 

When you vote, tell your politicians that the Pono Project provides local jobs AND protects our precious natural resources.

Forward on the Pono message on YOUR social media sites - help us build the groundswell that will change the giving paradigm for these groups.

We encourage supporters to share our social media to promote not only the Pono Project itself, but the organizations we fund by following us on Facebook and Twitter. We will also be using Pinterest, Vimeo and YouTube for all of our video and photo outputs.

"The Pono Project is extremely important and is looking forward to building conservation efforts and assisting other organizations in these tight budget times... We are encouraging others in the community and the travel industry to assist in this very worthwhile effort."

~ Stuart Funke d'Egnuff - Executive Director Tri-Isle RC&D

 

BIG MAHALOs to all of our campaign sponsors so far:

story:
Make a difference. Support Canada's Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25.

All across Canada, youth are taking charge and standing up for the protection of Canada’s wilderness and natural resources. This month, we need your help to give them the recognition they deserve.

Over the years, we’ve been inspired and motivated by these Canadians. Youth across our nation are looking at their hometowns and communities and acting to ensure their friends and family, now and in the future, will be able to enjoy the same quality of life that we do now.

Canadian youth are starting community gardens after seeing how local food systems can create healthier people and healthier communities. They’re researching and helping preserve wildlife all across the globe after seeing the devastating effects of poaching and other illegal activities. They’re advocating for what they believe in, including protesting development that will compromise impacted communities.

In short, they’re an amazing, innovative group of youth that deserve recognition. And we hope you can help them get the accolades they deserve this holiday season.

Want to see how the program works? Check out the Rules and Regulations from last year’s Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25 program. You can also see last year’s winners online.

How We Use Your Contributions

The Starfish Canada is a volunteer-based, nonprofit organization that celebrates and amplifies youth environmental stories. We want to ensure that outstanding youth get outstanding recognition. Your monetary contribution to our Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25 program today means we’ll be able to do more in 2015 - bigger events, bigger rewards for our Top 25, and more ways we can help these environmental champions get the word out about their respective causes.

Your Impact

Your contribution to The Starfish Canada help us celebrate and amplify the stories of the extraordinary youth taking extraordinary action. We want to continue showcasing these inspiring stories and the youth that make us proud. Monetary contributions helps us by:

  • Allowing us to celebrate youth in local Canadian communities, with goals of reaching new Prairie communities in 2015; Quebec & the Maritimes in 2016; and Canadian Territories in 2017. Contributions help us hire local organizers to help spread the word about our cause.
  • Expand our program objectives. If we are successful in our Indiegogo campaign, we will be able to provide bigger and better prizes for finalists and to further amplify their great environmental stories. 
  • Further connecting the finalists to each other's causes and programs. We have social media groups and pages to help Top 25 groups connect with each other, but we'd like to do more. Contributing to our Indiegogo campaign allows us to develop more resources that these youth can utilize to connect their common causes.

Questions?

We are happy to chat about the Top 25 program in any capacity. First, check out the Rules and Regulations from last year’s Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25 program. You can also see last year’s winners online.

Otherwise, feel free to connect with us at info@thestarfish.ca and we will be sure to connect with you within 24 hours.

Other Ways You Can Help

We're looking for people to help us celebrate and amplify these amazing youth environmentalists. 

  • Share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Check out our current volunteer opportunities and connect with us using the online form. We'll get back to you within 24 hours.
  • Share information on the Top 25 program with your friends or family. 
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter.
story_txt:
Make a difference. Support Canada's Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25. 
All across Canada, youth are taking charge and standing up for the protection of Canada’s wilderness and natural resources. This month, we need your help to give them the recognition they deserve.
Over the years, we’ve been inspired and motivated by these Canadians. Youth across our nation are looking at their hometowns and communities and acting to ensure their friends and family, now and in the future, will be able to enjoy the same quality of life that we do now.
Canadian youth are starting community gardens after seeing how local food systems can create healthier people and healthier communities. They’re researching and helping preserve wildlife all across the globe after seeing the devastating effects of poaching and other illegal activities. They’re advocating for what they believe in, including protesting development that will compromise impacted communities.In short, they’re an amazing, innovative group of youth that deserve recognition. And we hope you can help them get the accolades they deserve this holiday season. Want to see how the program works? Check out the Rules and Regulations from last year’s Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25 program. You can also see last year’s winners online.  How We Use Your Contributions 
The Starfish Canada is a volunteer-based, nonprofit organization that celebrates and amplifies youth environmental stories. We want to ensure that outstanding youth get outstanding recognition. Your monetary contribution to our Top 25 Environmentalists Under 25 program today means we’ll be able to do more in 2015 - bigger events, bigger rewards for our Top 25, and more ways we can help these environmental champions get the word out about their respective causes. 
  Your Impact Your contribution to The Starfish Canada help us celebrate and amplify the stories of the extraordinary youth taking extraordinary action. We want to continue showcasing these inspiring stories and the youth that make us proud. Monetary contributions helps us by:



Allowing us to celebrate youth in local Canadian communities, with goals of reaching new Prairie communities in 2015; Quebec & the Maritimes in 2016; and Canadian Territories in 2017. Contributions help us hire local organizers to help spread the word about our cause.

Expand our program objectives. If we are successful in our Indiegogo campaign, we will be able to provide bigger and better prizes for finalists and to further amplify their great environmental stories. 

Further connecting the finalists to each other's causes and programs. We have social media groups and pages to help Top 25 groups connect with each other, but we'd like to do more. Contributing to our Indiegogo campaign allows us to develop more resources that these youth can utilize to connect their common causes.

story:
Our Marine Conservation Center on Long Island was devastated by Hurricane Sandy, but we're not giving up!

Nature can be a beautiful and a terrible thing, and we've learned both of these lessons at the Ernst Marine Conservation Center (MCC) in the past few months.  'We' are The Ward Melville Heritage Organization, a not-for-profit 501(c)(3) corporation on the North Shore of Long Island.  We create and teach educational programs for students of all ages at the MCC, located at our 88-acre wetlands preserve.  The MCC was nearly destroyed by Superstorm Sandy in late October, and we are struggling to rebuild this "living classroom" for the community. Everyone at our organization works hard to preserve this special place: WMHO's Youth Corps, their families and friends, and community members plant spartina annualy to prevent erosion of the coastline, and remove invasive species like pepperweed from the area to prevent it from spreading.  But our love and hard work couldn't prevent a natural distaster, which is why we need YOU to help us rebuild!

Here's What We Need:

We have already raised funds to gut the entire building and install new flooring, insulation, and sheetrock ... but we still have a long way to go!  Here's what we still need funding for:

  • Carpeting for the classroom floors
  • Vinyl flooring for the bathroom
  • Heating and air conditioning units
  • Trim work

 

There are tons of awesome perks as a great big THANK YOU for helping us to preserve our marine classroom.  Receive gratitude in the form of thank you letters from our elementary school-aged Salt Marsh Explorers, wetland-themed tees and mugs, and even distance learning programs LIVE from the MCC!

This is Who You're Helping:

By helping us to rebuild, you're supporting marine education for students on Long Island and all over the world.  In addition to our on-site programs at the MCC, we offer distance learning programs that connect classrooms to our incredible, unique estuary with LIVE interactions.  Imagine what it feels like to introduce a live horseshoe crab to a student in Minnesota who had never even HEARD of a horseshoe crab (much less seen one!), then telling him that these creatures are older than dinosaurs ... by supporting the MCC, you're supporting amazing moments like this.

 

These Are Ways You Can Help:

Contributions are the best way to help us rebuild and get back to teaching and learning, but there are also other ways you can help us!  You can:

  • Contribute to the rebuilding of our amazing MCC
  • Don't clam up about our campaign: spread the word through Facebook, Twitter, and email
  • Visit our website to learn more about WMHO and all of our education programs

On behalf of all of the students, educators, community members and activists, and the fragile ecosystem we are all fighting to preserve, thank you!  We think you're pretty amazing (and the happy herons do, too).

story:
The Mu Optics Thermal Imager

The Mµ Thermal Imager is the first affordable thermal imager with the resolution and software capabilities to make it useful to DIY homeowners as well as construction professionals. Technology originally developed for industrial use can now be readily available to you as an accessory for your smartphone, tablet, laptop and computer.  With the ease of use of a smart phone app but with enough visual clarity (19,200 pixels), accompanying information, and functionality to enable the user to make wise choices concerning their homes.

Up to now, cameras of this quality have cost anywhere from $2,000 to $22,000, and up to $150 a day to rent.  Our intent is to get the retail price of the Mµ Thermal Imager below $325 initially. 

We've heard from realtors, house inspectors, farmers, contractors, firemen, building maintenance staff, medical practitioners, plumbers, pilots, electricians, insurance companies, parts manufactuerers, OEMs, oil field hands, and many more professions that all believe that this product could assist them in their day-to-day lives.  

Our funding goal is high, a mistake on my part as it may leave people with the concern that we won't be able to deliver the Thermal Imager if we don't hit that goal.  I was more concerned that people would not continue to consider purchasing a perk if we went over the funding request.  

We have various venture capital options open to us to fund the project through to completion.  The financing people are hard on our behinds to get this product in the market.  The idea for the IndieGoGo campaign came to us from one of our financial advisors; suggested as a means to retain a greater share of equity in our company during the earlier days of design and prototyping.   So...regardless of meeting our goal here or not, the Mµ Optics Thermal Imager is coming to market and all the early adopters and IndieGoGo supporters will definitely see their purchases delivered.  These IndieGoGo purchases are not devices we expect to make a profit on, our profits will come when we see the the Mµ Optics Thermal Imager in the Big Box stores we intend on selling through.  We are working through the final evaluation of three image arrays and associated lenses to ensure quality levels, reliability, and cost.  We are under NDA's with a number of our parts suppliers and need to respect those agreements.  Our optics path is also something we believe is unique and is part of what makes our device affordable.

What we hear from so many suppliers and potential clients is that this is just the beginnings of the potential for these devices.  

 

LOWER YOUR HEATING AND COOLING BILLS!

THE PERFECT GIFT FOR PEOPLE WITH EVERY TOOL IMAGINABLE IN THEIR TOOLBOXES. 

Our camera sees in the infrared spectrum of 7 to 14 micrometers which allows you to "see" the temperature of most anything in the range of -86 to 192 degrees Fahrenheit (-66 to 90 Celcius).

You'll be able to identify heating and cooling losses in your home and business, find lost pets in the dark, know just how cold your children's toes are when they ask you to turn up the heat, etc.  At home you can educate your family on ways in which they can stop energy losses due to their bad habits (such as leaving on a bathroom vent for longer than necessary). It’s a great tool for the DIY homeowner as they look for overworked electrical circuits and check the water heater and ductwork for energy leaks.  

In construction or renovation of buildings you'll be able to identify poorly insulated areas and badly wired electrical outlets before you put the drywall up. You'll find places where water has penetrated the structure where it should not have. Identifying mold and moisture is a much easier task with the Mµ Thermal Imager.

We can't wait to see what people will do with it.  How people use the Mµ Thermal Imager is something were not certain of yet, but we know that very quickly we'll find out just how useful it is.  How easy it is to find an pet in the dark, or to elevate hide and seek to another level!

 

                               iOS AND ANDROID COMPATIBLE.

 

Our software allows for:

  • Ease of operation - all functionality is through the touchscreen on a smartphone or tablet or a mouse on a computer.
  • Still image capture - high resolution of 160x120
  • H.264 Video recording -  no time limits beyond your device's memory limitations 
  • Selection of specific points for temperature information - Zoom window for pin point accuracy.

  • Blending of regular images with the thermal images for better views of what you're seeing - sometimes it's easier to tell what you're looking at when the IR image is blended with the regular video

  • Split screens between between both images - again, letting you know exactly what your seeing.

 

  •  Gradient Overlays

 

 

  • Selection of Farenhiet or Celcius.
  • Crosshair - for pin-point accuracy 

    • Charges via USB - use the same charger you use for your mobile device.
    • Long battery life between charges - all processing is done on the computing device so we expect more than an hour of record time between charges.
    • Lightweight-no heavy lens to balance
    • Focus free from 1.5 feet to infinity

 

Our goals with the camera and the software are simple at this point; make it capable, easy to use, and affordable.  Download the App from the app store of your device.  After attaching the Mµ thermal Imager to your smartphone or tablet via an adhesive polymer (that peels off without leaving a residue), you connect via USB to the base of the Smartphone (or tablet, etc.) the user will start the application just as they do with any app, with a finger touch to the app icon. At that point the screen will fill with the live video thermal image from the camera.  The image resolution is 160x120 (the images here are not yet fully optimized and will be much improved on the final product), and is more than sufficient to determine hot and cold spots via the color scale.  It is possible, but we don't want to promise this, that the camera will have a simple manual zoom (better image quality than a digital zoom).  Version Two will definitely include higher resolutions and include the ability to turn the image recorder on based on motion sensors.  

 

Why we made the Mµ Thermal Imager.

The median age of an American home is 36 years old.  To call an North American home a bit of sieve when it comes to energy efficiency is not a stretch; and the same is true most everywhere in the world. homeowners lose billions of dollars every year through heating and cooling losses due to poor insulation, old windows, and even just leaving your kitchen exhaust fan on longer than you need to.  You'll be able to see all these losses (and teach your children about them).   Go to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thermography to learn even more about what you can do with a thermal imaging camera.

 

Open Source

We recognize the desire by many people to be able to modify their electronics. While we can't get into specifics right now, we are making every effort to make the imager as open source as possible. 

 

What Lies Ahead

We've been in development now for a few months or so on the hardware and software.  It's a relatively simple device with few parts but some amazing optics.   The next task, and we're well along the way to finishing it, is to make the device smartphone, tablet, computer, and laptop ready in both functionality and size.  

The funds we're seeking will pay for the final development and packaging of Mµ Thermal Imager, the hiring of a worldwide sales consultancy to sell Mµ Thermal Imager’s through to the hardware stores, heating and cooling companies, and insulation companies.  We're also in the midst of finalizing our website which will train people in all the different ways in which thermal images can make for a healthier and lower cost home, videos from existing users and, of course, we need to place the first significant order for the parts, manufacturing, and distribution.  We have found significant interest in the Mµ Thermal Imager from the big box hardware stores and from insulation manufacturers that we may bundle the Mµ Thermal Imager with.  

We hope you'll help us get past this critical juncture in our product development and we promise to work as hard as we can to make it happen as quickly as possible. Our funding request will get Mµ Thermal Imager into the stores; however, the more funds we raise the lower we can drive our costs, and ultimately the price of the imager.   We’d love to raise enough to make an order for the electronics and optics necessary that will allow us to sell the imager for less than $325.  So....please, even if you see us reach our goal, consider making a contribution anyway, you’ll get the Mµ Thermal Imager at a great discount and help drive down the cost for all the contributors. 


Thank you so much for reading this if you got this far.

John and Charles McGrath
Mµ Optics 

 

P.S.  Happily, we can export our camera to the folowing countries.  Regretfully, we can't ship to countries not on this list.  Shipping fees are additional.

 

Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Canada, China, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Japan, South Korea, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, Turkey, United Kingdom, United States
