story:
SPONSOR A SUPERFOOD TREE IN NEED!

 Our Story

Hi. This is Brandon and Emily Majewski and a whole lotta tropical saplings. We are two horticulturists who moved to Mexico and we’ve got a problem: once we started growing tropical superfoods from seed we just couldn’t stop. As of writing, we have 307 plants representing over 50 genera (and by the time you read this there will be even more plant mouths to feed). We believe these plants, despite growing up on the streets in crates, tins, shabby buckets and coffee cups, are destined for greatness.

It’s beginning to feel like our family is a cross between the Duggars, Octomom and a Botanical Garden! So far we have been able to provide a very temporary space of love for these superfood trees in our apartment. But to reach their full potential our family needs land! Our tiny apartment is overrun with trees and plants that deserve better homes than milk jugs and tin cans!

Who We Are

Brandon and I have over 30 years of combined horticultural experience, ranging from areas of agriculture, greenhouse production, permaculture design, estate gardening and landscape construction, in various countries. We are confident that our passion and hard work, together with our family of tropical superfoods, will do you proud.

Being professional green thumbs, self-proclaimed foodies and persons who have experienced deep family losses due to cancer, we recognize the curative and nutritional contributions to society these plants can make. Plants like pittaya, saba nut, acai, noni, macadamia nut, champagne mango, moringa, breadfruit, pili nut, guanabana, cashew, avocado,  medjool dates, pomegranates, etc. These and many more little ones need a new home to spread their roots. Do we get a bigger apartment? Do we send out plants for foster care? Or do we secure green space so they can grow old together, in a stable environment, with all the love and care they need to thrive? We asked the plants and it was unanimous: land!

We believe that the world needs more tree crops. Not only do many species contain exceptional levels of starches, proteins, vitamins and medicinal qualities, they perform many other jobs: moderating climate, regulating water cycles, preserving soil, feeding a diversity of non-human life. On a planet with limited space, we believe humans need to start growing food with super-nutrition, on less territory and with more benefits than those of wheat and corn. Tree crops and superfoods do all of the above and more! Together we can create a space where knowledge about and seeds from these species are free for the taking.

Help us create a sanctuary for edible, useful, and native plants, here in Mexico. The first step is land acquisition, and this is $35,000 dollars ($454,700 pesos) more than what we have. The more funds we raise, the more land we can purchase to dedicate to these incredible plants-in-need.

Donating

For as little as $10 you can help one of our 307 Superfood Tropical Trees find a Home. By Adopting-a-Superfood-Tree you can sleep at night knowing you’ve rescued a little guy from the streets of the concrete jungle. By sponsoring a tree in need, you help us provide a committed, long-term approach to growing these superfoods. Your help will effect plants and people for generations. We hope you, like us, believe that every Superfood tree deserves the chance to grow…because each tree can make the world a better place in so many ways.

There will be various stages to creating a Superfood Sanctuary here in Mexico but by far the most important one is purchasing land.

 

PHASE 1: Land

We need to raise at least $35, 000 to secure land and get our little ones in the soil where they belong. The site location will be announced in the spring of 2013 when the acquisition is final.  15% of the funds will be used to purchase the necessities required for “The Big Plant Out”, i.e.-  basic tools, mulching materials, labeling, simple irrigation systems and small-scale nursery infrastructure. 2% of the ultimate funds will go towards the purchase and maintenance of 3 goats (amigos to assist in brush control with manure as an added fertilizer bonus).

(If we don’t quite reach our fundraising goal, every penny and peso will be put towards a down payment on land. While this would necessitate mortgaging the Sanctuary, we are confident that eco-tourism revenue from the site would allow us to eventually pay off our debt load. However, it would be so much better to meet the goal and have the space available to visitors free of charge, with free dispersal of seed and knowledge about these amazing trees. Help us make this possible!)

Bear in mind that with the dollar’s relative strength to the Mexican Peso, your donation goes even further...Also note that perks are to be issued upon completion of the campaign :)

Your donation will create a positive and life giving ripple effect for years to come.   With a focus on seed collecting, we want recipients of our seed stock to then promise to offer their future seeds to anyone with the desire to grow, as a gift. It TRULY is the gift that keeps on giving, and not just to humans, but to the ecosystem. This is where food chain meets a Chain of Giving.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course, we understand if you can’t financially contribute at this time. The economy IS a bummer. But you can help us in a big way by sharing our campaign and blog on Twitter, Facebook and all those other social media tools we don’t know much about because we are too busy watering…Tell your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors...We’d really, really appreciate it. Thank you for helping, however you can…

 

We know you have questions. Please see our blog http://adoptasuperfoodtree.wordpress.com/ for details on what your sponsorship is all about!
story_txt:
SPONSOR A SUPERFOOD TREE IN NEED!
 Our Story
Hi. This is Brandon and Emily Majewski and a whole lotta tropical saplings. We are two horticulturists who moved to Mexico and we’ve got a problem: once we started growing tropical superfoods from seed we just couldn’t stop. As of writing, we have 307 plants representing over 50 genera (and by the time you read this there will be even more plant mouths to feed). We believe these plants, despite growing up on the streets in crates, tins, shabby buckets and coffee cups, are destined for greatness.
It’s beginning to feel like our family is a cross between the Duggars, Octomom and a Botanical Garden! So far we have been able to provide a very temporary space of love for these superfood trees in our apartment. But to reach their full potential our family needs land! Our tiny apartment is overrun with trees and plants that deserve better homes than milk jugs and tin cans!
Who We Are
Brandon and I have over 30 years of combined horticultural experience, ranging from areas of agriculture, greenhouse production, permaculture design, estate gardening and landscape construction, in various countries. We are confident that our passion and hard work, together with our family of tropical superfoods, will do you proud.
Being professional green thumbs, self-proclaimed foodies and persons who have experienced deep family losses due to cancer, we recognize the curative and nutritional contributions to society these plants can make. Plants like pittaya, saba nut, acai, noni, macadamia nut, champagne mango, moringa, breadfruit, pili nut, guanabana, cashew, avocado,  medjool dates, pomegranates, etc. These and many more little ones need a new home to spread their roots. Do we get a bigger apartment? Do we send out plants for foster care? Or do we secure green space so they can grow old together, in a stable environment, with all the love and care they need to thrive? We asked the plants and it was unanimous: land!
We believe that the world needs more tree crops. Not only do many species contain exceptional levels of starches, proteins, vitamins and medicinal qualities, they perform many other jobs: moderating climate, regulating water cycles, preserving soil, feeding a diversity of non-human life. On a planet with limited space, we believe humans need to start growing food with super-nutrition, on less territory and with more benefits than those of wheat and corn. Tree crops and superfoods do all of the above and more! Together we can create a space where knowledge about and seeds from these species are free for the taking. 
Help us create a sanctuary for edible, useful, and native plants, here in Mexico. The first step is land acquisition, and this is $35,000 dollars ($454,700 pesos) more than what we have. The more funds we raise, the more land we can purchase to dedicate to these incredible plants-in-need.
Donating
For as little as $10 you can help one of our 307 Superfood Tropical Trees find a Home. By Adopting-a-Superfood-Tree you can sleep at night knowing you’ve rescued a little guy from the streets of the concrete jungle. By sponsoring a tree in need, you help us provide a committed, long-term approach to growing these superfoods. Your help will effect plants and people for generations. We hope you, like us, believe that every Superfood tree deserves the chance to grow…because each tree can make the world a better place in so many ways.
There will be various stages to creating a Superfood Sanctuary here in Mexico but by far the most important one is purchasing land. 
 
PHASE 1: Land
We need to raise at least $35, 000 to secure land and get our little ones in the soil where they belong. The site location will be announced in the spring of 2013 when the acquisition is final.  15% of the funds will be used to purchase the necessities required for “The Big Plant Out”, i.e.-  basic tools, mulching materials, labeling, simple irrigation systems and small-scale nursery infrastructure. 2% of the ultimate funds will go towards the purchase and maintenance of 3 goats (amigos to assist in brush control with manure as an added fertilizer bonus).
(If we don’t quite reach our fundraising goal, every penny and peso will be put towards a down payment on land. While this would necessitate mortgaging the Sanctuary, we are confident that eco-tourism revenue from the site would allow us to eventually pay off our debt load. However, it would be so much better to meet the goal and have the space available to visitors free of charge, with free dispersal of seed and knowledge about these amazing trees. Help us make this possible!)
Bear in mind that with the dollar’s relative strength to the Mexican Peso, your donation goes even further...Also note that perks are to be issued upon completion of the campaign :)
Your donation will create a positive and life giving ripple effect for years to come.   With a focus on seed collecting, we want recipients of our seed stock to then promise to offer their future seeds to anyone with the desire to grow, as a gift. It TRULY is the gift that keeps on giving, and not just to humans, but to the ecosystem. This is where food chain meets a Chain of Giving.
Other Ways You Can Help
Of course, we understand if you can’t financially contribute at this time. The economy IS a bummer. But you can help us in a big way by sharing our campaign and blog on Twitter, Facebook and all those other social media tools we don’t know much about because we are too busy watering…Tell your friends, family, co-workers, neighbors...We’d really, really appreciate it. Thank you for helping, however you can…
 
We know you have questions. Please see our blog http://adoptasuperfoodtree.wordpress.com/ for details on what your sponsorship is all about!

story:
Traducción a español mas abajo 

Summary

Sure We Can is a redemption center and sustainability hub in Bushwick, Brooklyn, which has been serving the community for 11 years. In addition to providing container-deposit redemption service, we view it as our responsibility to apply our effort and creativity to the worsening problems of consumption and waste in general, the consequences of which are exacerbating climate change and making the world a less clean, safe, and healthy place for our families.

This year, we've applied ourselves to the issue of single-use plastic film, which frustrates recyclers in New York City and across the world. It's ubiquitous, being used in restaurants, retailers, pharmacies, and in innumerable other places. NYC's 2020 plastic bag ban is a step in the right direction but is not close to sufficient: exceptions for wholesalers, restaurant delivery, and others mean plastic film will remain a part of our city's landscape, continuing to blight our streets and clog our recycling centers.

Sure We Can aims to address this creatively by first collecting single-use plastic film from consumers who don't wish to send it to the landfill, and also from local businesses, then "upcycling" it into sheets of durable, one-of-a-kind material. This new plastic can be used for all sorts of purposes: fabricated into reusable bags, sewn into clothing or accessories, or incorporated into new artistic or creative projects. Check out our first partnership, with Brooklyn designer Zero Waste Daniel: https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/caitochs/t...

With our current setup, we can only operate on a very small scale. In order to make a meaningful impact on the plastic film problem we need to make upgrades to our workshop facility. These changes will permit us to scale up our collection and production capacity, while also increasing our efficiency. By donating to this project, you will be contributing directly to the removal of single-use plastic film from New York City streets, and its reconstitution into something beautiful, unique, and long-lasting.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget:

New heat press: $650

Floor leveling, weather-proofing, electrical improvements, materials/labor: $2500

Fan ventilation system install, purchase/labor: $300

Industrial sewing machine and 15,000 yds of thread: $600

Laboratory scale, .01g: $150

Workshop tools, including rotary cutters, mats, and lighting: $300

Buffer for contingencies, additional labor costs, and Indiegogo's cut: $500

 

With these needs fulfilled, we'll be in a position to meet our incoming production demands. In addition, by contributing, you can participate in our project in a tangible way! Starting with gifts as low as $10, you can be a real part of our work, from having your name painted on our donor wall, to commissioning a custom piece of material, or even coming to learn the process for yourself. Our aim is to include you in our team of world-changers!

If we are unable to reach our goal, we will use the funds to do what facility improvements we can. Our budget is prioritized with most important on top, least important below, and we will follow that guide, using the resources available to us. If we surpass our goal, we will use the additional funds to take the next steps in our project: to pay for the labor required to design and create prototypes of reusable bags, wallets, and other accessories.

 

The Impact

Plastic degrades, but it doesn’t biodegrade.  This means that plastic microfibers not only permeate the soil, air, and water system but also become increasingly toxic over time because they absorb other contaminants and get passed up the food chain by animals. In New York City, plastic film poses an even more pressing problem because this toxic material is not recyclable through the city's recycling program. In addition, plastic film which gets put in recycle bins by well-meaning citizens ends up clogging recycling machinery, reducing the efficiency of the whole city's recycling. Residents of New York State discard 23 billion plastic bags annually. In NYC in 2017, 122 pounds of plastic film per household went into the waste stream. Multiply that by 7 million households--it's a serious issue. Most of this plastic use will not be addressed by the city's exception-filled 2020 plastic bag ban.

Our upcycling program aims to address this not only by reducing the volume of plastic which blights our streets and curbside waste, but also transforming that plastic into high-quality, long-lasting goods which serve a practical function, project individuality and creativity, and raise awareness, all at once. By contributing to our infrastructure upgrade, you will directly increase our ability and capacity to collect this destructive material and to educate and elevate our community.

 

Risks & Challenges

This undertaking is inherently risky: we believe our plastic material is important and valuable, but market forces can be merciless. In order to have a real impact with this project, we need to make sure we have an efficient, effective, clean, and safe workspace, and we need to work with others to gather single-use plastic which has been or will be discarded. Our challenges are to make strong and long-lasting facility improvements, and cultivate a supportive network. Our work is just one organ in the body of a sustainable economy, so we need to make sure we do our job right, and that we meet the needs of our community! Thankfully, we have staff with expert knowledge in building to make sure our workshop gets outfitted just right, and strong relationships with local canners and businesspeople, who will help us with sourcing.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate, please spread the word about this project! Alternately, if you're in NYC, come visit us and volunteer! If you know someone who might be interested in using our material, or who works with plastic film and doesn't know what to do with it all, put them in touch with us!

The more people are talking and thinking about the materials and practices which tend to be taken for granted, the more awareness will organically spread, and the more changes will become evident in the culture. No effort is too small!

 

En Español:

Resumen

“Sure We Can” es un centro de reciclaje sostenible y de apoyo de continuidad sin ánimo de lucro en Bushwick, Brooklyn. Hemos proporcionado por once años un espacio comunitario por los lateros (personas que recogen latas, botellas y otros envases ya utilizados) donde se puede reunir y trabajar en paz y con dignidad. Además de promover  empleo y trabajo decente, lo vemos como nuestra responsabilidad de aplicar creatividad y esfuerzo en combatir el cambio climático enfocándonos en los problemas de consumo y desechos. 

Este año, vamos a enfocar nuestra atención en el problema de lámina de plástico de un solo uso, que es un problema para recicladoras en Nueva York y en todo el mundo. Está en todo lugar, restaurantes, minoristas, farmacias y otros innumerable sitios. La prohibición de bolsas de plástico del 2020 de NYC representa un paso adelante, importante en la buena dirección, pero no es suficiente. Las excepciones de los mayoristas, entregas de restaurantes, y otros significa que la lámina de plástico va a seguir en la ciudad llenando nuestras calles y obstruyendo los centros de reciclaje. 

Queremos abordar este problema con creatividad comenzando con la colección de lámina de plástico de un solo uso; consumidores y negocios locales que no quieren enviarlas al vertedero.  Después, convertiremos la lámina en folios durables de material único. Este plástico nuevo podría ser usado para muchos propósitos: bolsas, accesorios, o para incorporar en proyectos creativos. Lee sobre nuestro primera colaboración con el diseñador Zero Waste Daniel:   https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/caitochs/t…

 

Por ahora, solamente podemos operar en una pequena escala. Necesitamos actualizar nuestro taller para que podamos tener un impacto en el problema de lámina de plástico. Las actualizaciones permitirá aumentar nuestra capacidad de producción y colección. Donar a este proyecto es contribuir directamente a la eliminación de lámina de plástico de un solo uso en NYC y la creación de algo precioso, único, y duradero. 

 

Lo Que Necesitamos y Lo Que Obtiene

Nueva prensa de calor: $650

Reparación del suelo, impermeabilizacion, cables eléctricos, materiales/mano de obra: $2500

Compra e instalación del ventilador y mano de obra: $300

Maquina de coser industrial, 15,000 yardas de hilo: $600

Escala, .01g: $150

Equipos de taller; cortador giratorio, esterillas e iluminación: $300

Mano de obra adicional, porcentaje para indiegogo: $500

Con este apoyo estaremos en la posición de atender a las demandas de producción en el futuro.  De tal manera que tu contribución participe en nuestro proyecto directamente. Comenzando con una donación de $10, recibes un regalo, puedes ser parte nuestro trabajo desde tener tu nombre en la pared de donantes, tener tu retrato hecho de plástico, hasta visitarnos y crear tu propio folio de plástico. Nuestra intención es hacerte parte de nuestro equipo de cambiadores del mundo.

Sí no podemos llegar a nuestra objetivo, vamos a usar los fondos para hacer los mejoramientos que podamos, comenzando con la primera cosa en nuestro presupuesto. El presupuesto está organizado primero con la cosa más importante al comienzo y la cosa menos importante al final. Si ganamos más que nuestra objetivo, usaremos los fondos para comenzar los próximos pasos en nuestro proyecto;  pagar por la mano de obra necesaria para crear los prototipos de bolsas reusables, billeteras y otros accesorios. 

 

Impacto

El plástico perdura en el medio ambiente por largos periodos de tiempo y no puede descomponerse completamente. La energía de rayos ultravioleta rompe el plástico que se desperdicia creando microplásticos. Ahora tenemos evidencia que existen estos microplásticos en la tierra, el aire, y el agua en cada parte del mundo. Además, el plástico actúa como un imán en sustancias tóxicas. Cuando esta ingerido por animales, puede hallarse en toda la cadena alimentaria. El problema de lámina de plástico es muy significante en NYC porque no es reciclable en las instalaciones de reciclaje de la ciudad.  

En adición, las láminas de plástico que está reciclado en una papelera de reciclaje obstruyen las máquinas y reduce la eficiencia de el reciclaje de toda la ciudad. Los residentes del estado de Nueva York desechan 23 billones de bolsas de plástico cada año. En NYC en 2017, 122 libras de lámina de plástico entró al flujo de desechos de cada vivienda. Multiplica eso por 7 millones de viviendas- es un problema grave. La prohibición de bolsas de plástico del 2020 de NYC no va a afectar a la mayoría de los que usan plástico. 

Con nuestro programa estamos tratando de combatir este problema no solamente reduciendo el volumen de plástico, pero también transformandolo en productos durables y bien hechos que pueden tener una función práctica, proyectar individualidad, y crear conciencia. Con su contribución puede ayudarnos a crecer directamente nuestra capacidad de coleccionar el material destructivo y educar y elevar nuestra comunidad.  

 

Riesgos y Desafíos

Creemos que nuestro material plástico es importante y valioso y que las fuerzas del mercado podrían ser despiadados. Para tener un impacto significante con este proyecto, necesitamos estar seguros que tenemos un taller eficiente, efectivo, y limpio. También necesitamos trabajar coleccionando plásticos de sólo un uso que ya ha sido desechado. Tenemos el desafío de realizar mejoramientos sólidos y duraderos y desarrollar nuestra comunidad de apoyo. Nuestro trabajo es solamente una parte pequeña de una gran economía sostenible. Por eso, necesitamos estar seguros de hacer bien nuestro trabajo y satisfacer las necesidades de nuestra comunidad. Afortunadamente, tenemos un experto trabajando con nosotros quién puede asegurar que nuestro taller está perfectamente completo! También, ya tenemos relaciones fuertes con lateros y empresarios locales que van a ayudarnos con el abastecimiento.

 

Puede Ayudar de Otras Formas

Si no puede donar, por favor ayudenos a difundir el mensaje de ese proyecto! En el futuro, si está en NYC, puede venir a visitarnos y trabajar como voluntario. Si conoce a alguien interesado en nuestro material, o a alguien trabajando con plástico, que no sabe qué hacer con lo que sobra, por favor póngalo en contacto con nosotros!

Nosotros queremos más personas que hablen y piensen sobre los materiales y las prácticas de consumo que muchas veces son dadas por hecho. Cuanto más conciencia se extienda más cambios vamos a promover en la cultura. Ningún esfuerzo es pequeño!

Los residentes del estado de Nueva York desechan 23 billones de bolsas de plástico cada año. En NYC en 2017, 122 libras de lámina de plástico entró al flujo de desechos de cada vivienda. Multiplica eso por 7 millones de viviendas- es un problema grave. La prohibición de bolsas de plástico del 2020 de NYC no va a afectar a la mayoría de los que usan plástico. 
Con nuestro programa estamos tratando de combatir este problema no solamente reduciendo el volumen de plástico, pero también transformandolo en productos durables y bien hechos que pueden tener una función práctica, proyectar individualidad, y crear conciencia. Con su contribución puede ayudarnos a crecer directamente nuestra capacidad de coleccionar el material destructivo y educar y elevar nuestra comunidad.  
 
Riesgos y Desafíos
Creemos que nuestro material plástico es importante y valioso y que las fuerzas del mercado podrían ser despiadados. Para tener un impacto significante con este proyecto, necesitamos estar seguros que tenemos un taller eficiente, efectivo, y limpio. También necesitamos trabajar coleccionando plásticos de sólo un uso que ya ha sido desechado. Tenemos el desafío de realizar mejoramientos sólidos y duraderos y desarrollar nuestra comunidad de apoyo. Nuestro trabajo es solamente una parte pequeña de una gran economía sostenible. Por eso, necesitamos estar seguros de hacer bien nuestro trabajo y satisfacer las necesidades de nuestra comunidad. Afortunadamente, tenemos un experto trabajando con nosotros quién puede asegurar que nuestro taller está perfectamente completo! También, ya tenemos relaciones fuertes con lateros y empresarios locales que van a ayudarnos con el abastecimiento.
 
Puede Ayudar de Otras Formas
Si no puede donar, por favor ayudenos a difundir el mensaje de ese proyecto! En el futuro, si está en NYC, puede venir a visitarnos y trabajar como voluntario. Si conoce a alguien interesado en nuestro material, o a alguien trabajando con plástico, que no sabe qué hacer con lo que sobra, por favor póngalo en contacto con nosotros!
Nosotros queremos más personas que hablen y piensen sobre los materiales y las prácticas de consumo que muchas veces son dadas por hecho. Cuanto más conciencia se extienda más cambios vamos a promover en la cultura. Ningún esfuerzo es pequeño!

story:
Our Short Story

It all started with kitchen chemistry, dumpster diving and lots of wine... bottles.

Elemental Essentialz has developed a variety of safe, toxin free, household cleaners in the only refillable, zero-waste packaging, currently available.  Better still? No plastic containers. We realize there are many opinions out there about plastic, probably as many as there are types of plastic.  Bottom line, there are alternatives.  We chose reused wine bottles.  The decision was ground breaking. With one simple choice EE would minimize the need for plastic, decrease energy consumption due to production by over 90%, and virtually eliminate packaging waste.

So here is what we need.  $20,000.00 Why? We are too big to work from the kitchen anymore. In order to keep our products economical, we need to purchase our supplies in bulk. We also need to work with a research lab to make sure we extend the shelf life of our products without adding any harmful chemicals.

Luckily we have found the perfect lab... and we are ready to take the next step.  With your help, the buzz that has already started will spread. We will prove truly safe, effective and eco-friendly cleaning products exist.  You will have helped change the expectations for the industry, eliminated thousands, if not millions, of plastic bottles from being thrown away, and helped to make our homes safer places for our families.

Join EE, donate to our cause and you'll also be donating to The Autism Research Institute, The Chemical Sensitivity Foundation and to The Children's Heart Foundation.

The Longer Story - Impact

A person weighing 150 lbs will throw away over 90,000 lbs of garbage in their lifetime.  Plastic containers will make up a pretty good chunk of that trash. 

Synthetic preservatives and other chemicals found in many cleaning products and plastics will cause headaches, allergic reactions, respiratory problems, and a host of other ailments.
 
Unnecessary waste in our landfills and poison in our homes are unacceptable. Elemental Essentialz is in a position to change this reality now and in the future. Our unique products and philosophy serve a need that is not currently being met by even the most forward thinking companies and grocery stores.

Don't be satisfied with the status quo. Join EE and be creative, be natural, be economical.

What We Need & What You Get

Join EE, donate to our cause and you'll also be donating to The Autism Research Institute, The Chemical Sensitivity Foundation and to The Children's Heart Foundation.

One thing I learned very quickly as a chemistry teacher turned entrepreneur, is we pay mostly for packaging.  The second thing I learned is a widget can cost $20.00 if you buy 1 of them, or $0.20 if you buy 10,000 of them. I also learned you don't save money by getting your bottles donated.  The cost of de-labeling, washing and storing is more than simply buying the bottles new.  We don't want to buy them new... our energy consumption would skyrocket. The third thing I learned, even cleaning supplies have shelf lives if they don't have preservatives in them. 

 

So here is what we need.  $20,000.00 Why? In order to keep our products economical, we need to purchase our supplies in bulk. We also need to work with a research lab to make sure we extend the shelf life of our products without adding any harmful chemicals.   We have been very fortunate to find a great lab / manufacturer and we have finalized our formulas. But their minimum order is 5,000 bottles... each. That is 25,000 bottles plus another 15,000 bottles to make our 4-packs.

 

After this initial order is placed and made available, the buzz that has already started will spread. We will prove truly safe, effective and eco-friendly cleaning products exist.  You will have helped change the expectations for the industry, eliminated thousands, if not millions, of plastic bottles from being thrown away, and helped to make our homes safer places for our families. 

 

If we are unable to reach our goal, this dream... which has sparked revolutionary change in how we treat ourselves and our planet will end much to soon.  

 

Join EE in the movement to reduce and reuse! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to donate or not, you can still help simply by spreading the word.  Tell your friends, your families, your doctors, your bosses and employees.  Especially tell your grocery stores! Ask them to visit our website at www.elementalessentialz.com and place an order.  We can't wait to be available nationwide.  If you are reading this, I'm sure you are already tech savvy so use the share tools! Follow us on twitter. Like us on facebook. Connect with us on LinkedIn. Hit us on YouTube.  We can't wait to see you - and see you often!


More details... if you are still reading and want more background / philosophy / history


As a McKinney North Chemistry Teacher, with experience in developmental intervention, I was familiar with the research linking hidden chemicals to increasing developmental and health issues. So, I started to create truly safe cleaning products. The products turned out to be amazing. The number of people requesting these safer, greener alternatives exploded, and Elemental Essentialz was born.


The idea to choose reused wine bottles came to me in a restaurant as I watched bottle after bottle, go from table to trash. The decision was ground breaking. It was also messy, and a little humbling, but with one simple choice EE would minimize the need for plastic, decrease energy consumption due to production by over 90%, and virtually eliminate packaging waste.


The bigger picture - our philosophy: We very quickly realized, our good idea had become many great ideas.  Elemental Essentialz is more than a business making and selling products.  Ours is an effort to help consumers bridge the gap between knowing what is right and being able to achieve it. We are a new company, revisiting an older way of doing business. We are excited and driven by our mission - to improve health, minimize energy consumption, and decrease waste.

Join EE in our movement to Reduce and Reuse!  Why? You know its right. And we are here to help.

story:
the why:

the incredibly different nonprofit organization:

the definition of sustainability is the capacity to endure. we have created an organization that will help people save money, be better stewards of our planet, live a sustainable lifestyle and help people that can not help themselves. we feel that passion, enthusiasm and sheer drive paired with a diverse culture designed within a sustainable belief system is one of the most powerful tools we have to create change; nrgeneration has been designed with this in mind every step of the way. our team consists of like minded, multi-disciplined and highly talented individuals with a “solutions not excuses” mentality.

NRGeneration is an organization founded by social entrepreneurs dedicated to the mission of making sustainability viral. we are a nonprofit branding, sales, marketing, educational and humanitarian institution that covers the entire sprectrum of green products, services and information. in the past these concepts have been tried in pieces but never as a whole. the purpose in running this campaign is to define our company to individuals, businesses and organizations that have the same vision we do and that want to get behind a very dynamic group of people with the ability to evoke change. 


our vision:

NRGeneration’s vision is to start a revolution within sustainability. simply put, our mission statement is: “to make sustainability viral!” we truly think everyone has a general awareness of the problems and issues going on, but until they are presented simple, cost effective solutions there isn’t any motivation to change. our team is focused on bringing solutions to these problems to the american public.

our vision for this organization is to provide one place people can go for the latest and most up to date information on green technology, building processes and trends. we want to provide the american consumer with one stop shopping for all of their needs from green home products, d.i.y. sustainable technology, renewable energy, energy efficient retrofitting, home building and energy efficient financing. for example, very few people realize that energy efficient financing is available. this knowledge will alleviate first cost pushback and allow them to roll it into the mortgage and actually have a positive cash flow when the project is finished. if done properly a person can pay their home off up to 10 years earlier or even save enough money to help send a kid to college. with the rising costs of basically everything, especially energy, there is no time like the present and no other organization that offers this to consumers.

our organization is partnered with some of the largest distribution companies, green manufacturers and green advocacy organizations in america. we did this to ensure consumers would get the best of everything including the lowest prices, most up to date information, best financing rates and the best experience possible. the most important thing that we have done is ensured that a percentage of all transactions originating from nrgeneration will be donated to our foundation.  these donations will be in the clients name so that even the less fortunate will be afforded the gift of sustainability. we intend on using these donations to retrofit or build homes for low income families, the elderly, wounded american heroes and sick children. giving back is our whole intention…


click the image below to see our "the why" video

 

your impact: 

by choosing to become a member of NRGeneration you we be helping us set our foundation deep. Your donation will fund:

  • our NRGeek! showcase series pilot (see below for information)
  • development of our NRGeek! portion of our website
  • our official launch at SXSW Eco
  • facilitation of the NRGrad challenge for the future
  • development of our NRGreen! products portion of our website
  • development of  our NRGreen! solution providers portion of our website
  • development of the NRGo! financing portion of our website
  • development of our "I owe it to my kids" smartphone app
  • our permanent headquarters
  • a huge social media campaign to drive our revolution


backing us can have big rewards!:

being a backer of NRGeneration will be rewarding for years to come and our initial donor drive on indiegogo will show what we are about to the entire country. our only donor drive in 2013 will be this campaign which will be followed by another campaign in march 2014 that will help produce our documentary film. so for all of you early adopters, eco warriors and visionaries who want to get in on the ground floor, here is your chance!

in addition to priority access to our new website, be the first to have our smartphone app, our fantastic t shirts and dopper net- zero water bottles; 





if we hit our mark of $150,000 (it does not matter how we get there, either through donations or corporate sponsorships) your backing us will get you a huge bonus. at swsw eco on october 9, 2013 we will pick our co-stars(from certain backer levels) to star in our NRGeek showcase series pilot. this is the energy independence and education chance of a lifetime! there will be a section in our pilot video for every topic listed below and it gets better: 


our sponsors have agreed to let you keep the stuff as a bonus for being an ecostar in the pilot!!!!


we will be shooting the pilot for the NRGeek showcase series and will be picking 6 lucky ecostars @ sxsw eco on on october 9, 2013 on the following topics. just click the links to find out more!


  • the truth about affordable solar. we will be demonstrating an affordable solar energy installation and dispelling the myths about renewable energy using a solar world sunkit 4k solar energy system valued at $16,000 to demonstrate - video sponsored by ad clean energy and solar world


  • uber efficient hvac. we will be showing america how to save up to 60% on their cooling costs by installing a solar cool (up to 5 ton) solar thermal heat pump valued at $15,000 - sponsored by eco solar technologies


  • energy knowledge is power!  we will show america the value of knowledge. we will perform a comprehensive energy audit and energy efficiency action plan valued at $3,000 while explaining how this is the first step to energy independence - sponsored by ibs advisors llc


  • the unknown value of window film. we will install nano-ceramic window film for a home valued at $2,500 to demonstrate how this small investment can save as much energy as a 2.5k solar system - sponsored by geoshield usa 


  • led's vs solar. we will retrofit the lighting in a home to LED lighting valued at $2,000 and demonstrate how a $30 led lamp cam be as effective as a $1000 solar panel - sponsored by viribright led lighting


  • the value of ventilation. we will install a solar powered attic fan valued at $750 to demonstrate how proper ventilation can reduce your energy costs and make your home more comfortable - sponsored by super green solutions



ways to help:

this indiegogo campaign means a lot to us and if you feel the same way we need your help! these types of campaigns are a great way to raise awareness for your organization but people have to know about it. NRGeneration is 100% behind our backers and we will commit our time to you over the next 30 days to help you in any way we can to raise awareness of this campaign. 

here are some ideas:

  • share this campaign via your social media network. this is one of the best ways to help us spread the word and if your going to be on facebook anyway, well?????
  • have a campaign backing day at your office or social group. our cvo byron will do a skype call and answer any questions that you may have and you will get to meet him!
  • if you are a college student please organize a backing event at your university. byron would be happy to do a skype call to answer your questions and there is also an additional perk here, we will be launching the NRGrad Challenge in October at sxsw eco! by joining up you will be one of the first to hear the details!
  • if you are a thinking about a corporate sponsorship please contact us via email at partners@nrgeneration.org to arrange for a phone call with byron and an additional skype event for your employees.


the birth of a revolution:

click the images below to learn more about our future programs!

 


click here to view or download our exectutive sumary

 


personal donations:

as we said before, membership has it's rewards. by backing us on a personal donor level you will become the momentum for a fantastic organization that will make a difference. you see the reason we are doing this is simple: to share our knowledge and be the change. we believe that if we give people the resources and education that change will happen. we also believe in our donors, if you did not believe in our movement you would not have become a donor. we will be giving priority access to all of our events and programs to our members as well as a pretty cool perk this year with our energy independence giveaway! we have some very exciting things coming up over the next year and you will be in the drivers seat as a early adopter!

if you donate at a $55-$199 level please click here to download our backer profile. please fill it out completely and email it to  backers@nrgeneration.org so we can put your picture on our website

 

corporate partner donations:

we are not a sit around and wait for it to happen organization and what this means for our corporate partners is a treasure chest of marketing opportunities. between our launch, documentary film and showcase series we will very quickly become a household name and with your membership you will come along for the ride! 

if you are donating at a corporate partner level please click here to download our corporate partner profile. please fill it out completely and email it to partners@nrgeneration.org so we can put your company information on our website

story:
We are a farm based on community and place. Our goal is to provide delicious, nutritious, and beautiful food with wildlife conservation in mind.


Our values may not be unique, but our approach may just be revolutionary. Lone Rock Ranch operates under the guide of permaculture principles with an emphasis on building organic and inorganic resource pools. While our farm's garden follows strict guidelines disallowing the use of unnatural chemicals and only locally sourced organic materials (composted horse manure ect.) what separates us from the crowd is our devotion to diversity; of produce, both domestic and wild, and in the ecosystems our farm engulfs.



Lone Rock Ranch was born through the obligatory need felt by Carl Mierek to both cultivate land and nurture wilderness. After recieving a degree in Conservation Biology from St. Lawrence University, Carl worked at a variety of non-profits and farms including; The Albany Pine Bush Preserve, Wyomanock Farm and Center for Sustainable Living, The Center For EcoTechnology, and finally Project Native, a non profit nursery with the goal of preserving regional native plants. Reflecting on his time spent at work in nature preserves, he realized the incredible diversity of delicious wild harvests the forests of New York state have to offer. Bringing his time spent in both wild and cultivated lands together, the blueprint for Lone Rock Ranch was born. This spring he has broken soil with his permaculture vision on land that has been farmed by his family for three generations.

Modern agriculture is an industry ruled by debt and economies of scale. Lone Rock Ranch is a maverick of a venture striving to avoid the burden of debt through this campaign and innovative problem solving in the field. Our economy is of quality and the attention paid to details is what allows us to produce more intensively on our acreage without any external inputs. We are far from the agrochemical cycle of conventional agriculture and striving to go beyond the label of organic to a farm that is truly in balance with its place.

It is our hope that as our place develops we will have greater opportunities for you to join us here. By joining our CSA or visiting our farmstand you can see our progress firsthand. Future ventures may include monthly dinners on the farm highlighting the season's produce and educational workshops on topics across the environmental spectrum, but our place isn't ready yet and that's why we need your help!


1) Native Food Forest

(Wild Ramps!)

Part of your funding (ideally being matched by federal grants) will go directly towards the of purchase of native plant seed mixes and nursery stock from our friends at the non-profit Project Native and will effectively:

  • Enhance native plant biodiversity
  • Create crucial pollinator habitat
  • Establish populations of wild edibles and medicines for annual harvest 

We hope our forest garden project will be an inspiration and a critical case study for the increased use of woodlands for non-timber forest products.

What we need;

  • ~60 seedlings x ~$20 = $1200
  •  Wetland, Woodland Edge, Grassy Meadow, and Pollinator seed mixes = $200

The populations and diversity of native plants has truly suffered through habitat loss and the introduction of invasive species. Rebuilding the diversity of our wild plants will not only benefit the ecosystems and food webs they play a primary role in, but also increase their resiliency to new threats such as climate change. 

Foraging is becoming increasingly more common, but increased pressure on foraged crops very often can lead to their decline. By seeding our land we hope to reintroduce crops that were lost long ago and replenish the stock of those populations that have endured. In this way the woods of Lone Rock Ranch will not only contribute ecosystem services such as water filtration and carbon sequestration, but also yield marketable products. This model of forest production may serve to be increasingly useful as we struggle to preserve wildlands, while also providing for a growing population.


2) Shelter and Fencing

Starting a farm takes a good deal of capital up front and we need to get building homes for our domestic plant and animal inhabitants. A small greenhouse is needed for propagating seeds and for season extension into spring and fall. Likewise our future inhabitants of ducks, chickens, goats and all other potential candidates need a safe place to stay on our farm. Fencing is also needed to protect plants and animals from the farm's resident predators including deer, groundhogs, hares, foxes, fishers, bald eagles, mountain lions, and coyotes. Oh my.

All natural construction and reused material options will be explored to limit the total costs, but not all expenses can be eliminated. Funding from this campaign will contribute to these infrastructure developments as such:

  • Greenhouse: $1000
  • Small Livestock Barn: $1000
  • Mobile Coop x 2: $200
  • Fencing for 2 Acres: $2400

This funding would allow for a great diversity of plant and animals to be grown here on the farm, enhancing the stability of the farm as an ecological system and sustainable income. 


Total Goal : $6000

Any additional funding received will only up the ante of our projects and allow us to do more!

All contributions are welcome, whether it be through a monetary donation, spreading the good word, or volunteering your time on the farm, your help is deeply appreciated.


Our farm is located on Tannery Rd. in Westernville, New York outlying the Utica Rome metro area. The land acts as a wildlife corridor running from adjacent Clark Hill State Forest to nearby Buck Hill State Forest and is at the southernmost extension of a larger wildlife corridor stretching up through the Adirondack State Park to wild areas in Vermont and Ontario.

If we are neighbors, please consider stopping by for a scheduled tour or subscribing to our CSA and recieving a weekly share of produce this summer. More information can be found at:

Lone Rock Ranch @ Facebook

story:
Thanks to all that have contributed! The motorcycle is on its way, but his is only the beginning of our historical journey. We continue to ask for your support. Please go to http://www.indiegogo.com/Be-Part-of-History-and...TTXGP to be part of this and contribute! Every contribution no matter how small will help us reach our goal of competing in the grand finale in Spain later this year. It’s simple to get involved and together we will make history! If you want to donate via paypal, please go the www.werkstattsf.com.
We will be updating this site regularly to keep you informed!

Road racer Jennifer Bromme and the Werkstatt Race Team will be on the starting grid on May 14-16, 2010 for the first round of the TTXGP at Infineon Raceway. The First ever Zero carbon motorcycle race ever! Bromme will be riding the Mavizen TTX02 electric superbike, and will show that electric motorcycles are viable, and the future!

We need to raise about 10k (the batteries alone are 15k) over the weekend so we
can commit to the complete race series, which will take place in 4 venues in
North America. If we place in the top 8 we will get to race internationally,
battling teams from the UK and Italy in the final race in Spain

story:
What is 2041? What is the IAE? Why is it important?

2041 is an NGO founded by Robert Swan, OBE –the first person to walk to both the North and South Poles. Its mission is to “inform, engage and inspire the next generation of leaders to take responsibility, be sustainable, and know that now is the time for action in policy development, sustainable business generation and future
technologies.” Its key and main goal is to ensure that the last great wilderness on Earth is never exploited for commercial, military or other reasons besides science and education. 2041 aims to do this by transforming the Protocol on Environmental Protection to the Antarctic Treaty from a temporary agreement into a perpetual moratorium.

The International Antarctic Expedition (IAE) is one of its key events throughout the year. It is an endeavor that brings together representatives from the industry, other NGOs and education institutions from the world round for a two week “Leadership on the Edge” program. Throughout this time, participants are challenged to think
differently and generate new ideas and initiatives to help drive sustainability
back at their homes while absorbing foremost knowledge regarding the
environment and ways to make our relationship with the planet work.

Who are you funding?

You are funding three people across the world who have developed a friendship on account of a shared passion: environment and sustainability. We met through work –more specifically, through a network of colleagues who attended last year’s
IAE.  We are all business consultants, and we are passionate about using the skills we have learned through work to help craft solutions for social and environmental issues we feel strongly about.

Siddharth Sastri (New Delhi)

“Hello! My name is Siddharth Sastri and I’ve just finished my first year at Bain & Company’s New Delhi office. I grew up in India, and then did my undergraduate studies at Brown University in the US. Growing up, I’ve always been very interested in environmental sustainability and been involved in a number of different initiatives around that. However, when I went to the US and then returned to India, I realized that there was a huge difference in how low a priority the environment was in India, and the comparative lack of measures to combat the rising carbon footprint. I believe
that this expedition offers me a huge opportunity to be surrounded by leaders
in this space, and return to India armed with an arsenal of possible
initiatives to improve our sustainability.”

Luba Mandzy Herring (London)

“Hello!  I’m Luba, and I’ve been at Bain and Company for over 5 years.  Before that, I spent many years studying the relationship between humans and the environment.  Early backyard science experiments and home recycling attempts evolved into an undergraduate degree in Environmental Science and Public Policy at Harvard, where I studied the impact of land use on climate change, focusing on logging practices in the Brazilian Amazon.  I then continued this passion at Oxford with a PhD in Mongolia looking at how climate and humans have influenced the evolution of the Central Asian landscape. I’m now excited to join a group of passionate leaders on an expedition to the end of the world – and to the limits of our knowledge – to explore what we can do to conserve the precious ecosystems we live in.”

Diego Argüelles (Mexico City)

“I’m Diego, born and raised in Mexico City, a
place that once held the horrid claim of being one of the most polluted places
on Earth. I remember growing and being often prevented from doing sports
outside lest the air pollution would mess with our lungs. It was in part
because of this that, ever since I can remember, I have had an extreme love for
the outdoors and the wild. Throughout my life I’ve had the good fortune of
seeing some incredible places on this world: mountains, forests, rivers and
valleys. Yet, for all that good fortune, I’ve also seen how they have been
devastated continuously by the way we envision progress and business. Now, I’m
at a place where I can have an impact, a true, hard impact. With your help I
will join Robert Swan in his mission to save Antarctica and connect with the
worldwide 2041 network to push and implement sustainability initiatives.”

What will we be doing throughout the program?

First of all, we will be taking part in Robert Swan’s “Leadership on the Edge” leadership, education, survival and sustainability program set in the last great wilderness on Earth along with over 70 business and social sector leaders from more than 20 different countries.

Secondly, we will be volunteering our time to help the 2041 team
design and implement a series of workshops based on our personal and
professional experience. These workshops are aimed at helping the attendees discover inspirational models of leadership and effective ways to deliver and sustain
change.

Finally, we will be conducting 1-to-1 sessions with the attendees to personally coach and help them polish their innovative plans for sustainability initiatives they intend to implement in their home countries. Whether they plan to increase recycling or implement sustainable sourcing of materials, we are committed to ensuring that each initiative leaves the boat with its very own “Results Plan” and for each fellow expedition member to maximize their impact upon returning home. After the expedition, we will continue providing support to these and other initiatives created by members on the “2041 Global Network”.

The Impact

Last year, a group of friends who also share our passion, attended the IAE 2013. Throughout the program they delivered workshops and 1-to-1 sessions with all the attendees –similar to what we will be doing this year. Following from last year’s
mission, there are now ~70 environmental, corporate and community social impact
projects underway.

Here are some comments about last year’s 1-to-1 sessions:

“The time spent individually makes a lot of difference and this remains the highlight of the program.”

“It is very practical, enables one to break down a big project into small manageable tasks and one can easily review their job against objectives set to be achieved based on the time allocated.”

“Impeccable. Shout outs to each one of you! You all were experts. It was a joy
travelling and learning with you all. The entire team was professional and
well-informed. They all are very passionate about their jobs and it shows with
their commitment.”

We expect to build on their great success and continue helping people with passion to structure and implement their own initiatives. Also, our intention is to take this
opportunity to learn about cutting edge thinking in the sustainability issues that trouble our world and take this knowledge to create our own initiatives. Our final goal is to implement these initiatives and ultimately incorporate all our learning into our daily lives and work.

(If you are curious about what a 1-to-1 session entails, be sure to read our List of Perks on the right to earn your own private session.)

What We Need & What You Get

Our total fundraising goal is £20,400 (roughly ~$33,000 USD). This fund covers two things:

1) Expedition costs: (enrollment in Robert Swan’s “Leadership on the Edge” program, passage on the Sea Spirit, housing in Ushuaia, and other supplies)

2) Contribtution to 2041's running costs: Support for 2041’s ongoing work to support the protection of Antarctica and champion sustainability more broadly.


We are complimenting this crowdfunding effort with our own personal funds (which are going directly to airfare, gear and other incidentals).


As a ‘thank you’ for helping us out, we’ve come up with a long list of perks at your disposal –ranging from a postcard sent to you from Ushuaia (Capital of Tierra del Fuego and southernmost city in the world) to a 1-on-1 session to discuss your
personal initiatives to promote a sustainable world with one of us. You can read the full descriptions of these perks on the right (and contact us if you have any question or comment).

Other Ways You Can Help

Your help getting the word out is crucial. Earn some serious karma points by just mentioning us to your friends & family and sharing our campaign on your social networks –Twitter, Facebook, Google+…

story:
Short Summary

My name is Andrea. I am 17 years old and live in Fort Collins, Colorado. I am currently in high school and I am taking classes at the community college. I have always had a great passion and love for the wildlife surrounding me. I love to go hiking in the Rockies and swimming in the rivers. I have taken a Wildlife, Forestry, and Natural Resources class at the college and it has given me this great opportunity to go to Alaska and study the wildlife ecology. 
This campaign is designed to help me raise the money for me to go on a trip to Alaska. I have always lived in a landlocked state therefore i have only had the opportunity to study certain wildlife ecosystems. Going to Alaska i will be able to explore a new world of wildlife. I will be studying sea otters, bird migrations, glaciers and so much more. Within this study i will be able to learn what OUR impact is on these natural habitats. 
Contributors will help me to further my understanding and education of human wildlife interaction. I am planning to become a Wildlife Biologist and this trip will be an amazing first step in the door to my career. 

Where is your money going?

Travel, Food, Accommodations- $3000
Class Credits- $500
Equipment & Misc Fees- $500
If my goal is not reached the money will still go towards my trip. If the trip is cancelled for any reason, the money will go to paying for my next semester at FRCC.

story:
German version

Respect for nature and other living entities is an important foundation for a peaceful and happy society. Happy Kuh e.V. is an active non profit organization, which not only offers a safe and secure life long home for farm animals (specifically cattle), but has taken the duty to inform and show the society that a harmonic life between “animals and human beings” is possible.

Background

Since its foundation, in 2009, Happy Kuh e.V. has saved 7 cows, 7 oxen, 2 bulls and 4 sheep from an early death and at the same time given the opportunity to many people to meet the animals at the farm, learn about them and in this way develop sympathy and compassion for other living entities.

The animals and the project are taken care of by only one family (a couple and a 3 year old child). The farm is located in Thuringen, Germany. And, this is partly financed through sponsorships and donations, which cover the basic needs of the animals.


Service to the society
Happy Kuh e.V. aims to bring awareness of the reality of cows to society, by showing in practice how these animal live in adequate conditions, in freedom and harmony, without fear from slaughtering or misuse.


We also pursue to spread the word about cow protection through private visits to the farm, constant updates on the Internet and participation in festivals and fairs inside and outside Germany.

Happy Kuh also provides support and information about topics like: meat and milk production and adequate animal housing and transport. And offers seminars and presentations about cow protection, environmental conservation, vegetarianism, veganism and health.

Our hope is to share with society, what we learn everyday by taking care of the cows. And, in this way we teach our children to develop emphatie and respect for other living entities.

We endeavor to live what we preach, a simple living and high thinking, which means, to live a balance life, trying to practice self-sufficiency (we have a small organic garden and make many thing ourselves), and having enough time for our spiritual development.


Why is our work so important?

In this time of change and rethinking, we offer an alternative to the conventional agriculture and animal husbandry and in this way we make a positive contribution to the environment and animal welfare.

Groups of visitors are welcome to get in close contact with our animals, get to know and to love them. Children can closely experience and realize how calves and their mothers live together with much love, just like human beings.

We get continuous feedback from different people, of how their lives have been changed just upon seeing the cows.

if you get the opportunity to meet them, you will start thinking further and ask what is really behind hamburger, dairy and mass industry husbandry.

First we should reflect and ask ourselves:

What we really need to live happily and peacefully?

Are we using more than we need?

Is our greed stealing the freedom of others?

There are enough resources in this planet to fulfill the needs of everybody, modern consumption is the trigger to the depletion of resources, and one clear example of this is the beef industry. Large amounts of resources (water, soil, forest, food grains, etc.) are being misused and sometimes exhausted, so that we can get a piece of steak.


How you can help?

As with every big enterprise, our project costs also money, and our means are limited.

Last year the number of farm animals in our care has doubled, so we depend on extra sources of income.

The animals live in an idyllic place, undeveloped outskirt area, where no running water and electricity are available. In order to fulfill the basic needs and demands of the animals, we use our car daily for the transport of water, hay and straw.

Our car (bought a few years ago when the number of animals were much smaller), is now at the limits of its strength and to continue and develop our project we need a new stronger vehicle. 

For this reason, we offer you the chance to take part in financing the purchase of a new car. Ideally, this would be a pick up van or transporter, with 4 wheel drive, because the car will be used daily during all four seasons, on streets and in the countryside.

Our goal is to raise 10,800 € towards the purchase of an appropriate vehicle, which can do the job for the next couple years. Any amount is welcome, your gift will be invested directly in the care of the happy cows and oxen and in the education and information of the society.

You can also contribute by choosing one of the perks on the right. if you would like more information about us or our perks, please check our website www.happykuh.de or find us on facebook under happy kuh or get in touch with us info@happykuh.de


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute financially, you can still help!

Let´s do it together! Help us to spread the word about Happy Kuh project by e-mailing friends, sharing this link, and talking about this on social media.

Thank you very much for taking time to read our appeal!
story_txt:
German versionRespect
for nature and other living entities is an important foundation
for a peaceful and happy society. Happy Kuh e.V. is an active non
profit organization, which not only offers a safe and secure life
long home for farm animals (specifically cattle), but  has taken the
duty to inform and show the society that a harmonic life between
“animals and human beings” is possible.Background
Since
its foundation, in 2009, Happy Kuh e.V. has saved 7 cows, 7 oxen, 2
bulls and 4 sheep from an early death and at the same time given the
opportunity to many people to meet the animals at the farm, learn
about them and in this way develop sympathy and compassion for other
living entities. 

The
animals and the project are taken care of by only one family (a couple
and a 3 year old child). The farm is located in Thuringen, Germany.
And, this is partly financed through sponsorships and donations,
which cover the basic needs of the animals. 

Service
to the societyHappy Kuh
e.V. aims to bring awareness of the reality of cows to society, by
showing in practice how these animal live in adequate conditions, in
freedom and harmony, without fear from slaughtering or misuse. We also
pursue to spread the word about cow protection through private visits to
the farm, constant updates on the Internet and participation in festivals
and fairs inside and outside Germany.Happy Kuh
also provides support and information about topics like: meat and
milk production and adequate animal housing and transport. And offers
seminars and presentations about cow protection, environmental
conservation, vegetarianism, veganism and health.Our hope
is to share with society, what we learn everyday by taking care
of the cows. And, in this way we teach our children to develop emphatie
and respect for other living entities.We endeavor to live what we preach, a simple living and high thinking,
which means, to live a balance life, trying to practice
self-sufficiency (we have a small organic garden and make many thing
ourselves), and having enough time for our spiritual development.  
Why is our work so important?

In this time of change and rethinking, we
offer an alternative to the conventional agriculture and animal
husbandry and in this way we make a positive contribution to the
environment and animal welfare.

Groups of visitors are welcome
to get in close contact with our animals, get to know and to  love
them. Children can closely experience and realize how calves and
their mothers live together with much love, just like human beings.We get continuous feedback
from different people, of how their lives have been changed just upon seeing the cows. 

 if you get the opportunity to
meet them, you will start thinking further and ask what is really
behind  hamburger, dairy and mass industry husbandry.
First we should reflect and
ask ourselves: 


What we really need to live
happily and peacefully? 


Are we using more than we
need? 


Is our greed stealing the
freedom of others?

There  are enough resources in
this planet to fulfill the needs of everybody, modern consumption is
the trigger to the depletion of resources, and one clear example of
this is the beef industry. Large amounts of resources (water, soil,
forest,  food grains, etc.) are being misused and sometimes
exhausted, so that we can get a piece of steak.
How you
can help?
As
with every big enterprise, our project costs also money, and our means are
limited. 


Last year the number of farm animals in our
care has doubled, so we depend on extra sources of income. 


The animals live in an idyllic place,
undeveloped outskirt  area, where no running water and electricity
are available. In order to fulfill the basic needs and demands of the
animals, we use our car daily for the transport of water, hay and
straw. 


Our car (bought a few years ago when
the number of animals were much smaller), is now at the limits of its
strength and to continue and develop our project we need a new
stronger vehicle. For this reason, we offer you the chance to take part in financing the purchase of a new car. Ideally, this would be a pick up
van or transporter, with 4 wheel drive, because the car will be used
daily during all four seasons, on streets and in the countryside.

Our goal is to raise 10,800 € towards the purchase of an appropriate vehicle, which can do the job for the next couple
years. Any amount is welcome, your gift will be invested directly in
the care of the happy cows and oxen and in the education and
information of the society.

You can also contribute by choosing one of
the perks on the right. if you would like more information about us
or our perks, please check our website www.happykuh.de
or find us on facebook under happy kuh or get in touch with us
info@happykuh.de
Other
Ways You Can Help
Even
if you can’t contribute financially, you can still help! 

Let´s do it together! Help us to spread the word about Happy Kuh project by e-mailing friends,
sharing this link, and talking about this on social media.

Thank you very much for taking time to read
our appeal!

story:
UPDATE: We had a call with farmer Vernon H. Bowman, who was sued by Monsanto, to present him with the money you've helped raise for him. 

Here's a recording he made to thank you...
A recorded message from farmer Vernon Hugh Bowman

The Supreme Court ruled that this poor 76-year-old farmer has to pay $84,456 to GMO multibillion dollar food giant Monsanto. Let's help him out - and show our solidarity!

A poor 76 year old farmer, Vernon Hugh Bowman from Sandborn, Indiana had the courage and tenacity to fight Monsanto all the way to the Supreme Court, and says he doesn't have the money to pay the $84,456 he's been sued for. He barely makes ends meet, making do with old run-down tractors and second-hand seed from granaries.

Let's help help this farmer endure this ridiculous debt so he and his family don't suffer any more under the pressure of this evil lawsuit. It's important to stand united and not to let this farmer carry this burden by himself, because he has stood up for all of our rights to not have the world's food supply controlled by Monsanto.

If people rally around him with support it will show that Farmer Bowman's got allies and show that Monsanto has a growing groundswell of enemies.

Let's show how the People truly want our farmers treated.

Let Monsanto know they can’t bully family farms into extinction. 

Please share this everywhere you can.

Let's rally together and stand up to giant corporations who want to control our food supplies and our governments.

Yesterday someone on UPRISER.com suggested we "help this farmer pay this ridiculous amount of money. I feel it's so important to stand united and not to let this farmer carry this ridiculousness by himself."

We agreed. So we're starting this fundraiser for Vernon Hugh Bowman, because he had the courage and tenacity in his ripe old age to fight Monsanto all the way to the Supreme Court for all of us, and we ought to show our solidarity with him.

Net proceeds from this fundraiser will go to farmer Vernon Hugh Bowman (Indiegogo (not us) will take 9% plus transaction fees).

UPDATE: We finally got to speak with Vernon Hugh Bowman and he says he doesn't want to take the money, because he doesn't want it to go to Monsanto. He said instead he'd like it to go to a cause aligned with his ideals. When asked if he had a family member who he wanted the money to go to, he said he didn't want that because he thought it would be "dishonorable." So for the moment we have established an UPRISER Vernon Hugh Bowman fund which will be directed by the farmer himself. It could go towards anything from a cause that Mr. Bowman likes, to maybe buying him some seed that won't get him in trouble next planting season. Stay tuned. ;)

Mr. Bowman also would also like some help in a legal matter pertaining to the damages he's on the hook for, so if you know someone who can help him, please email help@upriser.com with "Farmer Bowman" in the subject line.

Your gift goes where this farmer directs it, for his own personal use. 
He may still refuse to give the money to Monsanto, and probably will try.

Farmer Bowman might even direct us to give the money to a close friend or family member who is shielded from this lawsuit. They could use the money to support him out of the reach of Monsanto.

If you have any questions, feel free to email us at help@upriser.com

Let's show our solidarity with the poor 76 year old farmer who had the courage to stand up to giant Monsanto.

story:
La meta es de referencia por las distancias nadadas, 103.4km (explicadas al final) con miras de superarla con creces y recaudar todos los fondos posibles para colaborar con el trabajo de Misión Tiburón. Links: Web / FB / IG

  • Dicha organización ayuda a la conservación de los tiburones y otras especies marinas. En este caso en particular mostramos nuestro apoyo al Tiburón Martillo, el cual se encuentra en peligro de extinción, gravemente amenazado por la pesca ilegal, el aleteo, la contaminación y la sobrepesca, además en Costa Rica es permitida su captura incidental.

Andrés López e Ilena Zanella (Misión Tiburón).

  • Nos sentimos completamente identificados a la causa ya que en numerosas ocasiones hemos realizado el Cruce Golfo Dulce organizado por Joe Bernini y en marzo de este año como parte de nuestra preparación para nuestras metas realizamos un doble cruce (28km) del Golfo Dulce, lugar de crianza del Tiburón Martillo. Los trabajos de Misión Tiburón fueron de vital importancia para que se declarara los humedales del Golfo Dulce como Santuario del Tiburón Martillo.

Sobre la labor de Misión Tiburón:

 
  • Nos unimos al empeño para crear conciencia a nivel local y gubernamental sobre la importancia de la designación de "Vida Silvestre" para que el Tiburón Martillo pueda ser protegido bajo la ley de Vida Silvestre de Costa Rica y nos mostramos completamente en contra de la reactivación de la pesca de arrastre que no sólo daña a los tiburones si no al océano en general.

Un Martillito sonriente :)

Pero cada vez quedan menos y los están masacrando :(

(Link CRHoy)

Ultramaratones:

Carolina Mora 38.6 km - Tampa Bay Marathon Swim
Rocío Mora 45.9 km - 20 Bridges(Swim Around Manhattan Island)
Diego Cantillo 45.9 km - 20 Bridges(Swim Around Manhattan Island)
Kurt Niehaus (entrenador)

Total: 130.4 km


Kurt Niehaus(entrenador), Rocío Mora, Diego Cantillo con camisetas de Misión Tiburón. (Link La Nación)


Carolina Mora. (Link La Nación)

 

El Tiburón Martillo es Vida Silvestre y no una especie comercial.(Nota)

Adicional, por eventos recientes:
No a la reactivación de la pesca de arrastre.(Nota)

 

Apoyemos y alcemos nuestra voz para preservar y cuidar a tan hermoso ser.

story:
Our Story

"Our Wet Dream" is an initiative geared towards making clean water accessible to villages all throughout Cambodia. Myself and a group of nine girlfriends are rolling up our sleeves and heading out east, in June, to empower the people, the land, and the way of life in these impoverished areas. Our fundraising will go towards building wells that will bring lifelong access to clean water for hundreds. These will be built and maintained by local Cambodians. This way they can sustain themselves long after we head back home. Some seriously incredible multi-tasking will be taking place. Aside from our well building initiatives, we're also setting out on cultural awareness missions to introduce the community to their new means of water.  By teaching hygiene classes, providing hand-on tutorials, and educating the communities, predominantly the children. We are hoping to bring a positive change that's been needed for years. Basic education like the importance of washing hands, brushing teeth, clean laundry, and hygiene upkeep. These efforts will lower the outbreak of diseases and offer a much healthier lifestyle.

 

The Impact

"There comes a time when one must risk everything, or sit forever with their dreams." Like my good friend Martin Luther King, Jr. I, too, had a dream. Mine involved the capabilities of numerous well-minded people driven toward one common goal. This dream drew upon contribution of a lot of hands in the pot. It was all fueled by CHANGE. This dream was dirty. And water, water was an intricate part to the dream… I guess you could say… I had a “wet” dream.

Water is something we use every day, numerous times a day, in many forms and activities. It’s the essence of life, we wouldn’t be able to live with out it. My dream was to bring access to clean water to all parts of the world.

The only thing is... this won't happen unless you help!

 

What We Need & What You Get


Well as much as we wish you could tag along... (We'll have to save that for the next dream mission. There will be plenty more to come, so stay tuned.) Our efforts in Cambodia can't happen alone. Financially the wells are quite an investment. We would greatly appreciate anything you can give that could help us get one step closer to making this CHANGE an actuality.

Each of us women who are embarking on this project made a pact to raise $3,000. This way between all of us we would have $30,000 to build and educate!  Each well costs around $375, so together we could be bringing water to several villages across Cambodia.

To involve all of you I put together certain perks for each donated amount. Unfortunately, I don't have a surplus of extra change laying around to offer you material gifts such as a custom made "Wet dream" logoed pair of underwear or "wet T-shirt" contest winner badges. Our funds are short, that is exactly why we are asking for your help in the first place! :) Makes sense, right? Okay.. I'm just checking.

Other Ways You Can Help Make a Splash

Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others'   Get the word out and make some noise about our Wet Dream, which has now hopefully become your dream as well. Spread the word! Use the share button to share with friends. The more people who know, the more lives saved. Change can only grow with water, and getting water requires as many hands as possible.
